3jJACFiyOGQnv7gp1FXe3Q.text: The bar tenders are rude. Went here with a few friends to day drink and they charged us for all the drinks that they messed up and did not make properly after telling us its on the house cause it was our bad. The food here is ok made my friend have food poising from chicken figures.. go figure.

8NA170TPZtCt4q4Mlb3OEQ.text: Skyler gives the BEST service every time I'm there!! She remembers my order and checks in regularly to make sure I'm set! 10/10 would recommend!

bqD2bFhaxD4X1S9C1SEdaw.text: OK, Devil's Advocate Bar & Grill is a package. You get the combination of a studenticos hangout bar, and a sports bar. And it works.   I came in and sat at the bar, ordered a beer and some wings. Actually, I ordered alot of wings. They showed up quickly and they were excellent. I say again, the wings are excellent. The service is a little confusing, because I was never serviced by the same person twice - but the personnel is polite and quick.   The only negative I can say is that it was loud in here, very loud. Maybe because of the football game that was on - but even so a little too loud for any kind of natural conversation.   Summary.  Its nice, clean and have a good atmosphere. The wings are rockin' and the service is great. I will be a return customer.  .. und das ist nach der kritiker.

GeVOb3lbD-TylPnEiJ6A5A.text: Great service, Lauren and the rest of the staff were awesome. The spinach salad with chicken is better than anything coming out of any fox concept restaurant. Great atmosphere for an ASU game. Go Devils.

RZWKr7ryjqSAzSMEf_lbzQ.text: It was all right I suppose. Our waitress was kind of... rude. She was just caddy and seemed really annoyed that me and my girl friend were there for lunch.   Despite the silly waitress, we got some giant beers and a few of their mixed drinks. Holy cow were the drinks delicious! That cheered me right up. Except then we realized two tables we were ahead of, got ALL of their food before we even received our appetizer. Might have been because they were all handsome dudes and the waitress seemed more interested in talking to them instead of doing her job.  Our appetizer was actually pretty dang good though seeing as it was just queso and salsa with chips, and we got some burgers. The burger was great. It was one of the biggest I've seen for sure. Haha.   I would probably go again if I was in the area and needed a drink really quick, but I won't be planning a night out there ever again.

fJ3vkIUhSmE4WGJVp6EpWw.text: The staff wasn't very friendly. They weren't rude, they just came off as if they were waiting till it was time to go home.   I ordered the fish and chips and I have to say, it was the greasiest fish I've ever had. I literally had to soak up the oil off the fish with a napkin. Something I would expect from a home meal. Not from a place where somebody cooks for a living.   I was also charged twice on my card for two different amounts. I was with a friend, but we had two separate bills and two separate cards. I'm sure they will take care of it but I'm not sure how that happened in the first place. Probably from the staff members who seemed to have other things going on other than taking care of their patrons.

s4D0p-dcSXJ_hnBj-QrwDw.text: Tacos are pretty good, but I wouldn't pay the regular price for them.  Taco Tuesdays where each taco is $1 is definitely worth the trip.  The atmosphere is cool as its full of a younger college crowd.

I8niHSdpFxpMlO42bmJFZg.text: Terrible service. Waiting over 20 minutes for someone to even come get our drink order. Service is always bad here and it's not even busy tonight.

kfcUU1g-70ky5SFziwtiug.text: I'm a huge fan of this place. This is one of my go-tos in the North Tempe area.   Happy Hour: Their happy hour is pretty good, getting a 4/5. They do 1/2 off all drinks and appetizers 4-7pm on weeknights. There are also pretty good daily specials such as Taco Tuesday and Pizza...Thursday? Regardless, their food is pretty good for the price and their bartenders do not skimp on the liquor in well drinks, regardless of whether it's happy hour. Thursdays beginning at 9 is buy one get one all well drinks, too.  The service is okay, but you can't be TOO expectant since they usually seem staffed pretty thin and the place is pretty much always busy. The staff is attentive, though, however infrequent they may be able to get to your table.  The ambience is awesome. They have leather armchairs at the bar and the entire place is done in wood and bookshelves. Its mostly a sports bar, but it's also a great college hangout spot. I've had some great nights here.  When it's cold, they have heaters out on the patio along with two fire pits in a seating area/lounge. They allow smoking outside on the patio too.

1dzKhvzPLQufhjf_pe9oZA.text: I've only gone during the week at lunch hour, but this medium-sized sports bar has a lot of food and drink specials.  Their wings are pretty good. Definitely above average. The medium wings are crispy and had just right amount of sauce. The sauce itself is more mild than hot, however their hot is definitely very hot! Out of the dozen, a couple of them came out dry.  The street tacos, $1 on Tuesdays, come with crumbly cotija cheese, cabbage, and a creamy cilantro sauce. The chicken was well-seasoned and were great. Very tasty. The shredded carnitas were very good but a couple of them came out dry. The steak seemed unseasoned and just didn't taste very good.  The burgers were just okay and the sliders are barely the size of a silver dollar. In both cases they seemed to be under-seasoned.  The pizza comes on a crispy crust and an underwhelming marinara sauce. And the cheese...I just didn't like. It definitely changed in flavor when the couple of slices I took back were reheated 4-5 hours later.  Service is spotty. It will go from friendly and prompt to almost non-existent depending on the day.  There are TVs all over the place but some are up really high and only of the 17"/19" variety. I'll have to try this place out when a big game is on.

CEF1dxsOGXrTHesO_k7woA.text: This is my works favorite go to place to grab a drink after a long shift, they have good specials and a very unique interior. Go check it, you won't regret it!

MpzxJ-HBQe3lEHpY2xM5tw.text: I decided to give this place a second chance and i was pleasantly surprised. The food was cooked very well and was delicious. The waitress i had was very attentive and my overall experience was a good one. I'll definitely be back for college football games this year. Go Sun Devil's!!

oNzMebks-9AwS4ya8BENrA.text: Great place to chill. Watch the game. Great beer. Dancing. Dinning.  Lots of fun. Good food. Burgers. Wings.

t-twsWsTW_jDnhuNQJljcw.text: Decent happy hour. Great atmosphere. Draught beer could definitely be colder. Icy mug would help

ggMqGG9VWfxFFQGD_1_bGQ.text: You know, it's not just about the food and the drinks sometimes.  It's the service that can bring you back or not.  With that being said...what service!?  Gosh, maybe my Engrish not goo and you didn't hear me co-wreck-lee, but when I request for my check maybe someone should attend to me to get it rolling!  Didn't think trying to pay was such a huge ordeal!  We even had someone go and chase down our "waitress" to ask for some help, but the Devil had other plans and she played a disappearing act.  However, before the Devil gets to me --- drinks at this place wasn't too bad - Enjoy!

LleRhJVz5SdV98bqRDhaWQ.text: I wanted to like this place because the girl was so nice over the phone when I asked if I could bring my dog to the patio. For the place not being all that busy the service was horribly slow. My poor dog and I waited an obscene amount of time on the hot patio for water and beer respectively - we're talking 30+ minutes. Can't comment too much on the food because by the time we finally got our appetizer of chips and guac (which wasn't horrible, but not great) we decided to head elsewhere.

dfAkyecFwH1pthoQtSz-LQ.text: Favorite happy hour 1/2 price drinks and apps. Best taco Tuesday of all time. $1 tasty street tacos that you can't beat anywhere.

c3S__63oCJUoZUD8YjWU5w.text: My favorite sports bar ever!  They have good deals and specials every night of the week.  Tacos on Tuesdays, pizzas on Wednesdays. 2-4-1 drinks on Thursdays 8pm-1am (my favorite), etc.  Happy hour 4-7 with 1/2 off all apps and drinks.  Huge bar area to get serves fast, nice patio, flat screens everywhere, shuffle board, and pool.  My only complaint is that they need larger bathrooms with more stalls; the lines get ridiculous on busy nights.

5t99tCptce2-spgQBLxUjg.text: Good happy hour specials. The cheese dip is AWESOME. Period. The rest of it is standard bar food. Staff is pretty good and will change games on tv upon request.

w63WShLpr9FtV-mYHXbCcw.text: Meh. There are so many other better bars in Tempe so I am not sure I would be back.  Went for a Wednesday night happy hour for cheap drinks and food.  Had 2 Devilritas, pretty tasty for $3 each. Husband had 2 beers at a good price.  The environment was nice and waitress friendly & attentive, but the food was not that great. Ordered the $6 buffalo pizza. Sauce was way to peppery and hot for my liking. Chicken rolls ok, but really heavy. Chips and dip trio also just ok.  I'm glad we only spent $31 for all of that food. Maybe the food reviews on here are good because everything tastes better when you are intoxicated.

_pAFDCJhePrXs0npaFIcbA.text: Always enjoy visiting especially open Mic to hear my Son play. The food is always good. However, the service outside is less than desirable. In fact it is down right bad. Every time the servers come outside, which is not frequent they walk by my table & never recognize us. At least say hello & I'll check back. I've worked customer service in banking & Home Depot for over 40 years & always prided myself on giving great customer service. The two female servers from Tuesday night, Aug. 29 definitely need more training on customer service, recognizing customers & saying hello to every customer that is outside. My son finally went inside to place our order & then it took 40 minutes for the food to arrive. All in all I rate the outside service a minus 1 & overall a 3.

EX1BXpu9hlPOPo8bOnPYKg.text: At least one tv visible from every seat, wait staff that is friendly and smiling, bar food to meet any requirements, and a large selection of beers on draft. Portobello wrap rocked.

vJnahFmpDAsBir4-TmgeEg.text: Good food. Relaxing atmosphere. Fun place to come for a few drinks. Some of there servers are not very attentive though.  If you asked one of the girls for another drink there response is important not your server. The guy bar tender with the beard is awsome though. Always friendly and is very attentive. That's why I'm giving four stars.

RBgrb-kONYDL-sDDvgEPkQ.text: We come often tonight the service was poor. we ordered ranch with our meal she brought it out after we finished the meal and still charged us. the worst part is when she picked up my credit card and shoved it in her bra till she got to the register to run it. I have never had a server put my CC down thier bra so disgusting.

mvXk7QSjUwNSvvFqy5vlMQ.text: We went during happy hour when the drafts and appetizers are half off. We tried the vegetarian tacos, nachos, and fried zucchini. I had the pear cider and my boyfriend got the gingerbread ale.    I would've given it all two stars if everything wasn't super cheap.  My biggest pet peeve with nachos is when the toppings/cheese only covers half the nachos. These nachos were the epitome of that. The flavor was nice, but I had a nice pile of topping-less chips at the end. :(   The fried zucchini wasn't completely fried so the inside was still doughy. The vegetarian tacos have minimal flavor. Cue all three hot sauces they have available.   My pear cider was pretty decent, but my boyfriend said the gingerbread beer was less than average.   The waitress was super friendly and it has a nice atmosphere. We went for the BCS Championship game and there are ample televisions for viewing. I'd definitely go back for another game, but definitely not solely for food.

sNaqHhnyrd93mHaZj8aBGg.text: I had lunch at this restaurant.   The atmosphere was great with music and a bunch of tvs. The staff was friendly and their menu had a lot of choices at a reasonable price.   I had the Cobb salad. It was great!  I will definitely come again!!!

RJnVAvxN2F5hCPyNITLuYg.text: We had been there all night on the devil on university and requested our tab 6 times and Phil the bartender said they didn't have it and after being rude the 7th time we asked for it finally found it. I'm a server myself and I know this isn't equivalent to what service should be like. They yelled at us saying we lost our own debit card three times and kicking us out until they finally found it! Bad customer service

sVA226ny-SuVrjlEpmnIlg.text: I wish I could give this place zero stars. To begin, they have the Arizona lake in their parking lot which poses as not only a safety hazard, but also an inconvenience for all customers. We went there the other night hoping to have some fun with our friends however we never even made it into the bar because of this lake they have in the parking lot and the rude customers this bar attracts. One of our friends slipped in mud walking in and while we were standing their helping her clean her foot and shoes, an asshole decided to speed through the puddle, probably finding it hilarious, and splashed us all leaving us soaked and covered in mud. My phone was ruined with water damage. We went to the front demanding to speak to the manager or someone on charge for the night, explaining the situation, and he laughed. We asked again to please get a manger, simply because that puddle needed to be taken care of immediately so this would not happen to other customers and to recommend they have security of some sort patrolling the parking lot because no one should be reaching speeds like this guy in the truck did. This is simply for safety precautions of the future. However, the kid checking IDs at the front refused to get a manager and we stood there waiting for 20 minutes, asking again if he was going to get the manager.  The fact that the management has completely over looked this reflects a complete disregard for customers and their safety and the lack of respect this business exhibits.  I will never be returning nor recommending this place to any of my friends.

VhFF0GYVtkFDLM7nPhiI_w.text: This spot is going down as hit and miss. They hit on the HH drink prices which go until 7pm Monday - Friday, half priced drinks, all drinks, and their reverse happy hour many days offer buy one get one drinks. The food here is on the miss side of the coin. They have a full menu of burgers, fries, sandwiches, etc. but their tacos here are mostly the only food I've had. I think I've had a fried something or other at one point or another and likely an order of wings; but again the food isn't why I visit. This spot is fairly busy all the time, again, think drink prices; those cheap drinks really keep this place in business. They do have a Taco Tuesday special on tacos, but I think there *might* be better places out there for tacos. Drinks are not amazing, you won't find anything special or exceptional, but you can't mess up a beer or an alcohol with a diet coke mixer, well, you can, but it's pretty difficult. Take this spot for what it is, a hang out and grab a drink, I like the atmosphere though!  Happy Yelping.

0nP-LWgvaO9E9VAeL-E1lQ.text: Great place to go for beer and a burger. Cool vibe with good service and seating areas. Huge bar, outdoor seating and lot's of TV's.   Good music and everyone talking and having a good time, good place to hang out.

Z3_PRNFfEV7t0vplmqH31g.text: Best. Bar. Ever. Their happy hour has a generous hour range and their prices are very good. Lunch hour prices are also amazing. The place has tons of tvs to watch the game, it's not very busy but the service is just so-so.  I've started going here regularly, it's probably my favorite bar.

rWkoNB-qg3JwlGKqW_KCSw.text: I really wanted to like this place. From the outside, it seemed cool. It isn't. The food, atmosphere, and service were well below average. Left disappointed and wishing I ate elsewhere.

ylHgNA4zZw-LR2pw0LNF5w.text: I came here to watch the football games and let me tell you that this place is so awesome!! They have so may tabs and the staff seem decently friendly.   It was super slow and I was told about the Bloody Mary bar, so of course I said YES!! I wasn't aware, which was partially my fault for not asking, that every time I went to get a "refill" I had to pay $8 I figured (this being a blonde moment) that I was going to pay a certain amount and it was good for the afternoon - that's how it is at several places I have been to. That's not the reason for my not so good review. I actually had to get up every time to get my drink replaced - what happened to my cocktail waitress?? The waitress I had wasn't super friendly but she did take my food order and nothing was wrong with it and I did enjoy my BBQ pork sliders.   My only recommendation is that if it's busy you may want to go elsewhere if you expect to have good service (service with a smile) or service at all. I was rarely checked on and that to me speaks mounds.

Hn2NCkf57oOzowbB8liO0w.text: I pass this place all the time and the Sun Devil in me thought that the UFC fight would be a great reason to stop in with my bestie in tow. I love the atmosphere..our bartender Cameron was pretty cool and poured us a great drink. We enjoyed our food, great quality and price. If you are looking for a chill place to watch your favorite sport that is comfortable and fun, this is it!

nbCnHv0FAt8fgoFIMB9tfw.text: After long drive to Phoenix from CA wanting to watch the Packer Game decided to stop at Devil's as we would not make it home in time for 10am kickoff asked for lunch menu was told not til 1pm. Passed on breakfast menu. Placed drink order. Waitress told us they may start lunch early as they received  requests for lunch.  All of a  sudden we  look around and their bringing out lunch food for tables around ours. Waitress never came back to tell us they were serving lunch. So we asked for lunch menu and placed an order of chicken tenders at start of 4th quarter. Last 3 minutes to end of game still no food. Waitress said be food will be up shortly. Waitress brings food we asked for plates and are told had no clean dishes. Waitress got us 3 lined food baskets. We ate and left.  Chicken tenders were good..  We''ve been to this establishment for happy hour. Always good food and service. Not today!!!! Won't go back for a game!

Qp9rWdF81_1kze7qHCn_JQ.text: Nice seating to accommodate you & a great bar. Awesome vibes,very friendly,welcoming, and fast. I ordered the jalapeno burger which was absolutely perfect. I'd recommend this location for a nice laid back evening with friends.

qjCTihVa3WQKb1QzPpVn1g.text: This sports bar is absolutely wonderful. If your having a hard day at work and your to caught up in the city environment that Tempe Arizona has to offer and your looking for a nice getaway but to broke to go to the nearest beach come to devils advocate! They offer a nice beachy vibe during the day with a bright and sunny environment with great service that makes you feel like your sitting right by the ocean without all of that sand! If your looking for a good place to go and get some delicious food for dinner and a more downtown Manhattan vibe at night this is the exact place to be! The service is perfect my personal favorite is Lauren!

CPDciBt3_8Ut3BMHZDKnQw.text: Loved the chicken strips! Best I've ever had!!!! Will be back for sure! Great happy hour too!

oOOPTD0SvYQn4GffKd2uPw.text: Originally introduced to this bar via the Tempe Beerathon and most recently Road Runner Sports Third Thursday run, I have also stopped here a few times for a drink. This is becoming a favorite place of mine to hang out after work when I am looking for a quiet happy hour. If I am not going with a group of people and just want to hang alone or with another person, this spot is an excellent sports bar, has great happy hour prices, and good food.   I have had the street tacos before - one night of the week they are $1. Small, but tasty. During happy hour 4-7 drinks are half price as is the food. I had the wings and while the hot had an underlying spicy flavor, they also seemed to be somewhat sweet. Either way they were good. I have also had chips and salsa before  - the chips are fresh and immediately out of the cooker and the salsa is spicy. They do have $1 pints, but I am confused when that happens. I thought it was 4-7, but it might have been until 4. When I received my bill my first 2 were $1, then others were $2. Still a good price.  Oh, and I have to say - the staff at the Devil's Advocate is the hottest in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Devil's Advocate - Tempe, AZ, United States. Just so you know...that handle is hot. Ouch!
Photo of Devil's Advocate - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Devil's Advocate - Tempe, AZ, United States

gx9y57mEALapK7S72va4oA.text: I think this is my place of choice for specials. There are specials (food and drink) every day of the week. Usually, the long island ice tea is my choice because it's only $4 on certain days. Also, $5 wings and $6 whole pizzas on other days. $5 giant mugs of beer too for the specials.   A lot of times, I only go on days with the long island special. The food is not bad for a sports bar and grill. I had the steak nachos, pizza and wings before and they were good. Depending on the days, service could be slow especially if there is a college game day or just a lot of people there.  What you should do is go on their website, see what they have on that day, and decide if you want to go. That's the best way to do it. Because some specials don't apply on college game days.  And plan out your trip with the light rail if you don't want to drive. It's a 5 minute walking distance from the University and Rural station. Then go drink and take the rail back home. Or take the rail Mill Ave for more drinks.  Like I said, check their website for the happy hour menu and the daily specials. Then decide if you want to go. There's also a sushi restaurant across the street, and a shwarma, Indian, Thai and pizza place next door too. If you don't want food at DA's, grab cheap drinks and go eat elsewhere.  Or grab some drinks and go to Fedex Kinkos next door to hang out. I'm sure the employees will love that. ;)

lBRDMyvCiObtESI4mRMD7g.text: Terrible food. Terrible Service. I went here on Valentine'sDay because it was close to my daughters dorm. I'm seriously allergic to onions. So I told the waitress "no onions on my burger, I'm allergic". 45 min later my daughters burger comes out.  Velveeta Cheese and not American cheese as seen in the menu. I was like ok gross, but my kid isn't picky. Then another 10 min goes by and my burger comes out. Onion ring ON my burger and a heap of raw onion on the lettuce next to it and my side said is smothered in diced onion! I'm like hold on! Wtf?! I told this very dim looking waitress, "I said I'm allergic to onions!" "She's like ooooh yea." She takes the burger back to the kitchen. A min later she appears with the SAME burger and a fresh salad. So I politely yet firmly ask "did you just remove the onions and bring me the same burger?" She replies "well yea, the onion was only touching the lettuce". I was dumbfounded. Are you f****** kidding me?!?! I will never eat here again! Clearly the waitresses are not college students. You don't give someone the same contaminated plate back when the have a serious allergen. If I could have gave 0  I would have!! Stay away from this place!

hTrnyGYX9QmSbTSgRIZTmw.text: Great happy hour deals, the tacos and rolled tacos for only 4 dollars are delicious. The beer on the happy hour list is half off regular price as well, which makes it pretty cheap.

k-TXjPLdlnoykbtqIuTL-g.text: I have been coming to Devils for over 2 years on Thursday and every UFC fight. It saddens me to give a terrible review to one of my regular bars.   A couple of us went to the bar for the Mcgregor Mayweather fight. We took to the patio where our server was Riley with the red hair. She was absolutely terrible! She refused to do individual bills, and it was impossible to get her. I understand it was packed and there are other customers, but when I order a water cup at 6 pm and never got it, like that is insane! I had to go to the bar consistently to get a cup of water.  I wish that was the only problem. Our group had to haul down other waitresses and back boys to get her, where she took forever to come serve our table! Now she did sort of well bringing our drinks after it took an hour to get her. She was an extremely rude waitress and was appalling over all. Gratuity is suppose to represent how well the server served the table. Riley complained to our faces as well as other customers about the poor tip when the service was terrible. Afterwards, she complained to the bouncer with the hat in which the bouncer said "get the f*** out for tipping bad." The bar has a right to refuse customers, but to kick out customers for tipping poorly? Under what law of Arizona does a bar kick you out for tipping poorly? Under what law of Arizona do I have to tip a terrible waitress! The bouncer was just extremely rude.  The audacity to complain about the tip after your service is insane. I personally feel you got lucky to even get a tip.   So thank you Riley the terrible waitress and the idiot bouncer with the hat for ruining one of our favorite places to eat and drink! Riley should give her tips to the back boys and other waitresses for that terrible service.

3CRZ_O-3BNb7XkZdR4x_4w.text: Went for the first time and loved it! My boyfriend and I went for Taco Tuesday happy hour. Great food, great drinks, great service, and great prices. We'll be coming back!

wa-e8WtDPm9mO0rWGYO0yg.text: Typical college area bar. Very casual atmosphere with lots of TV screens and loud music; don't expect to be able to have a conversation here without shouting. Service is friendly, parking is good, the drinks are OK. I ordered beef tacos, vegetarian tacos, and nachos with steak -- all were loaded with grease, and the tacos were borderline palatable. My suggestion: come here for enjoying company and having drinks, but if you are hungry, eat before coming here.

KmOSgVFpv8rBzLO7MrKoYQ.text: Cheap drinks for HH!  Cheap food for HH as well, but I'm not really too excited about the food.  I had a chicken tacos, a beef taco, and nachos.  None were very good... the tortillas tasted kind of like I imagine plastic tastes... and they were way too greasy (as were each of the tacos).  The nachos... hmmm, what can I say that is good about the nachos... nothing.  In fact, they were probably the worst nachos that I have ever had.  I really hate to knock a family-owned restaurant, but... perhaps the southwestern style cuisine on the menu should just be taken off and replaced by something else like burgers.    With that said, overall my bill only came out to $17 with two margaritas and three tacos on it!  When I'm in the mood to get out for without busting my budget, then I will be back... even though I probably will refrain from eating any of the food.

Uu9oZCtOuue2OgJNEs7r5g.text: Happy hour is off the charts. The prices are typically half off for appetizers, beers, and cocktails. SO GREAT.   I had the tacos which were so insanely good, the chicken rolls, mozzarella sticks, and the "con queso". Of course this was all shared but being able to taste them all, I thought that they were all awesome, especially at half off. Not that long before my last visit, I had the spinach salad with chicken. YOU WILL BE IMPRESSED. I was.  I can't tell you how many Thursdays in college I spent at Devil's as well. They have 2 for 1 drinks and that is a recipe for a stellar night. You may not remember it, but I assure you it was stellar.  Take the chance and try out Devil's Advocate regardless of the rating. I don't know where the negatives are coming from but I think for the price, it is grand.

q_PmtCGqjQ_mdisMynm6hQ.text: Girl that looks like Pocahontas sucks at waiting tables. I might as well serve my own beer at devils.

iHBfkghsHgwLNYqsPOqP5Q.text: Used to love going on Thursday nights,but unfortunately there service has become so overly rude! They have no manners last time I went to devils  One of the "security", shoved me right out of the way & of course I was annoyed & asked if he could say "excuse me " well instead he decided to light his flashlight at me & said "Move!" I actually saw this happen last time I was in there & the bartender glanced at me & said "it's because I put more than enough on this one"..like uhm what? We're paying for 2 not 1.... Horrible service!

8W8rzB0NIFNxVWmou5nA5w.text: Ok so I love this bar on Thursdays typically because it's 2 for 1 drinks and it's usually beautiful.  Well last night was one of the worst experiences ever. The girl I ordered drinks from was so mean, didn't smile didn't say thank you or even look like she gave any cares about anything. And then I went to the restroom and it ran out of toilet paper so I kindly asked the security guard who was in front of the male restroom if he could get us some or ask another associate to get some for the ladies.  His response was I don't care about y'all I'm guarding the men's room and I'm not leaving and I don't care so no I'm not. I again said well we are woman we literally NEED toilet paper if you can please ask someone else to get us some that'd be great. Again he said "girl I'm busy I don't have time to get y'all drunk asses toilet paper stop asking leave me alone" I then went to one of the og bartenders who I know has been bartending there for a while and asked to speak to a manager about the situation and found out the very rude bartender who was serving me before was supposedly the manager. I understand this is a "college" bar but service is everything especially for me who has been in the industry for years and this was just SAD. I definitely will not be back any time soon, I'll just wait out the cycle of associates.

j3lcygko1QrFN0WuOzrlKA.text: This place wasn't bad, but I was a little irritated by something. I called ahead, because I live in Glendale and this is a bit of a drive for me. I wanted to ask if I could not only watch the Diamondbacks game, but also hear the sound. I can go to any sports bar and watch the game without sound, but when I called they told us we WOULD be able to watch the game with sound.  However, once we got there we were told that we weren't able to watch the game with sound because the NHL playoffs and the NBA playoffs were on. I really don't have an issue with that, but I did have an issue with them telling us on the phone that they would do that for us.  As for the rest, the service really wasn't bad, the Caesar salad is a HUGE portion for only $6.50. We apparently got there during happy hour, so our first two drinks were 4 dollars, but they didn't give us any notification of happy hour until we got our checks.  During our time here we also ordered 2 additional drinks that were 8 dollars a piece. Again, not really a big deal but we had no idea what time happy hour was or when it ended. Most restaurants  tell us it's happy hour when we sit down.  Honestly, i'd probably go back to this place when the playoffs aren't on. They really weren't a bad place overall, but the communication leaves a lot to be desired. They did tell me if the playoffs weren't on, they would have been happy to turn the sound on for me. So, for now i'm just gonna leave it at 3 stars until I get another opportunity to try them out.

bAPleXliDu_YkSfnc6LcnQ.text: The bartender is a complete asshole..  I'm a man of few words. She left the bar 30 min before closing and wouldn't take orders

GYKmLaKW0UP2P3ED7kiHuw.text: Come here basically every Wednesday night for trivia night! The host is lots of fun and recognizes the regulars who come.   Food is decent bar food, and beer on tap can satisfy a ton of different tastes. I'm on the light citrus-y end of that spectrum. Wigs are okay, pizza is good!   Parking is great for being so close to Mill! Will be back next Wednesday!

photos.caption: Photo of Devil's Advocate - Tempe, AZ, United States. Trivia!!
Photo of Devil's Advocate - Tempe, AZ, United States. Sunspot

Bvx3EXZjPVKPdoF4coXOzQ.text: Ok. This is your standard sports bar with a fantastic happy hour. Seriously you can not beat it. We came here for the second time in a Saturday and while happy hour wasn't going on, we had a great time. Avery was our waitress and bartender. Apparently a few waitresses called in, but with Avery you wouldn't know it. Happy hour pricing brought us back once. But Avery will bring us back a few times a week. So thank you Avery we will see you next week

FrwmV53ny0FAqgGhlguJBA.text: Extremely bland food. If you want to be disappointed, come here. Made both my cousin and I sick after eating. Asked for medium rare burger, they gave me rare. The service was extremely mediocre. She never came to ask us how we were doing, and overall very displease. Never going again.

FrVBBqeZ7Hbf01BLuuNfsg.text: Now Devil's is a fun bar - don't get me wrong. But I had a bad experience with a particular bartender with a nasty temperament.   I walked inside and went straight to the bar to order a drink. Of course, it was crowded because it was Saint Patty's Day. I'd been waiting for 10 minutes or so, and a guy walks up next to me, shakes hands with the bartender (not who I'm talking about) and gets his drinks right away. I wait for another 5 minutes or so, getting more frustrated. Then another guy walks up, super nice, finally gets the female bartender's attention. I believe her name is Lauren. He explained, "These girls were here first", so I quickly asked, "Are you sure?" and thanked him. Then the bartender  says, "You lost your shot." and walks away from us without taking any drink orders... The guy was just trying to be nice... Couldn't believe we were treated in such a way.

fXbZEUkcvHPd2ZdvyZZ4tA.text: What can I say? Devil's Advocate is a solid establishment! It's a go-to place for a few drinks after work. I usually end up getting the quesadilla with steak. It's so good and greasy! The vibe here is great too. Pretty chill and not obnoxiously loud. Plenty of TVs to catch a game on. The servers and wait staff are all very nice people too.   Well done, Devil's!!!

n4z7m9l_UG_-xQlParyAhA.text: Danielle was our server... Fantastic service was very prompt and knowledgeable, will definitely be back had a fantastic experience! Backed up by the bartenders sky and Brandon amazing establishment! Will definitely be back

UnSKwoDDSgOppmbX0ezIFQ.text: Great place. Andy is a must see here. Hes runs the place amazingly! Games are fun and food was awesome. Waitress and cook doused my wings in buffalo sauce which was awesome. I always ask everywhere else and nobody ever puts strong amount of wing sauce on the wings. Much appreciated!!!  Great football atmosphere. TVs everywhere!

photos.caption: Photo of Devil's Advocate - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cozy fireplace and games.

89plZMttNDeRPGKryGwb2Q.text: So bad it's almost embarrassing to comment on. I have lived next door to this place for almost two years now and each visit only reinforces my previous judgements of how bad it truly is. I have giving this place it's fair shot now over 10 visits - the most recent being the worst... If you get a table away from the bar good luck seeing your server more than once an hour. If you feel the bar is better suited you're in for another rude surprise as well as the service there is equally as bad. It's truly a shame. Such a good location and venue wasted away by poor staff and management. The only real appeal left to this place is it's two for one specials on Thursdays... but to take full advantage you better know at least some of the staff on a first name basis...

jBxlijuhrJHiwo3YjPpuuA.text: Devil's Advocate has absolutely, positively the BEST sandwich in town in the 'Sun Devil Club.' Mixes the best attributes and ingredients of your favorite bar sandwich and country club snack. Pair that sandwich with a basket of french fries and one of their various ice cold beers on tap and it's an unbeatable lunchtime meal. Dinner's just as great, especially on Tuesday!! $1 tacos and $2 Dos Equis is the best deal in Tempe and the deal is good because the food is GREAT. Most importantly, this is the best spot in town to watch ASU football games in the fall and winter. A total Sun Devil bar!!

NX0OMrss0bOW9OF75OGMAg.text: I actually like this bar, but if you decide to come on Tuesday, beware of the bartender, Veronica.  She's unbelievably rude...like ridiculously rude and will complete ignore you.  Fair warning

JOh5f_cEX315feI3hnA4mA.text: I had to go here for a job-related event. I don't normally drink alcohol near my workplace (have to get home), but they don't card people who aren't drinking and have a nice atmosphere. Good place to hang out with the co-workers.

9rfqPlKr0ysLn71MoBzzPw.text: I am sure it's great for drinks only, but the food was not good. The place was empty and that should have been a clue because other places nearby seemed busy. The beer glass was dirty and the food had little to no flavor. I had a wrap and my fiance had a philly. 2 hours later he was sick. I don't think we will be going back.

qpYKJLJCrDWPgo4ha5Ze2g.text: Can't even write a full review because we sat for 10 minutes while 4 SERVERS sat talking by the bar. Made eye contact with two of them multiple times, but still no one came to our table. We left after 10 minutes, one saw us walking out and said nothing about it. They had maybe 4 other tables at the time. Worst service I've had in a long time, and absolutely will not be going back

R1HZQuJmz-d5UdTYwKihfQ.text: I am an advocate for Devil's Advocate!  This place has everything. Amazing specials on food and drinks every single day, plus they are Arizona State themed. It is the best place to be on game day for the excitement and camaraderie of fellow Sun Devil fans.  This bar recently sponsored my boyfriend's adult hockey league, and I'm sure our group of friends brings in half of their business; not because the place is dead, but because we're there for days/nights a week.  If you're looking for a place to get rowdy and yell at the TV, this is it. If you're looking for delicious and down to earth bar food and cheap but tasty drinks, hit the patio for lunch and enjoy the weather. If you're looking for a place to call yours, this is it.  Devil's has it all!

kzFUubf2FiiLuxgHCffUJw.text: This place is simply the BEST sports bar in Tempe if not Arizona! Great food, great drinks, great deals and most importantly great service!

kYxBLc6EljoNQZG3r6uYnQ.text: I really struggled wanting to give this place a 4. Their tacos are AMAZING (Taco Tuesdays!!!), pizza is great, and great drinks and prices.  Their service is TERRIBLE. It is not uncommon to not see your waitress for 20+ minutes, and forget about getting your drinks refilled.  Even with the terrible service this place has become a regular spot for the food and atmosphere.

-L8nb2amvWAnfkCfNIrRwA.text: My go to bar in college and still one of my favorite spots.  Everyone knows of the infamous Thursdays nights and gameday madness that makes Devils Advocate the go to college bar but I have a new found love for this bar as my go to lunch spot! By far the BEST lunch happy hour I have come across! Buy one get one burgers, $1 tacos, BOGO pizzas, and $1 domestic pints. All the food is awesome especially the tacos, and a cold beer is a great addition to the work day. Adam, the manager, always makes us feel welcome and typically the bartending/waiting staff is quick and friendly.  If you don't like crowds avoid Thursday nights, especially during school.   Keep it up DA!

VWCqy1gj39BTins2oQV10g.text: This is the best bar and grill in Tempe. All of the food is tasty and there is big list of drafts. The rotating specials are great especially Taco Tuesday, Thursday night 2-for1, and their $1 Coors Light drafts during lunch hour. Devil's has so many TVs around the bar, you'll never have a problem watching a game. The servers are always quick and work hard. They also handle large groups well.  The huge parking lot is a plus since you'll never spend time searching for a spot like on Mill. Huge convenience factor.

-t_JzrBmR0iSwGQh7BcNzQ.text: Best daily deals!   Perfect for college students - deals change daily.  Taco Tuesday and Karaoke Wednesday are personally favorites, always a fun and friendly atmosphere - packed on the weekends!

ivN4uxMvUMC_2WLO3SnxNA.text: Loved the name of this place, so i needed to investigate another happy hour. This HH goes til 7 with 1/2 price beer and a food specials menu consisting mostly of bar stuff. The $2 pretzel was killer; hot and buttery and had a decent queso dip on side. Not the same luck on the $4 street tacos. The chicken is thigh meat and the steak had no resemblence to steak or carne asada and the tacos were loaded with too much sauce and cheap cabbage. Pretty average beer selection and not all seats at the bar can view the tv screens. Nice patio though and there was one pizza with potatoes that looked unique that i need to try on next visit.  Not packed at all for monday night football.

The servers are impossible to get service from. & when I did finally order I waited an hour and a half for nachos just to hear that "They gave my order away to another table".Wait another 30 mins.... finally get my order. & then when the bill comes not even comped or discounted.

4a_iN-AcJ_Okwy1GO5mjcw.text: There is an entomology conference in town and while I'm eating, employees right next to me said that we needed to get the "fuck out" because they said we study "bugs." #ignorant #rude #stupid

x-dLyDC478r8Vn1kUY_Kbw.text: Their food is delicious - I would recommend going for Taco Tuesday ($1-3 dollar tacos). However, if you want good service, run! We love going there for their cheap food and beer, but we're always having to ask other waiters/waitresses to get any help.

Ao_wkZUo7TySv76nQcLBfw.text: I was in town for a few days and went to Devils advocate for a drink and some food. We had the best waitress Avery who really made out trip memorable. We ended up coming back everyday just to see her before we had to leave. Will definitely be visiting Devils every time we are in town! Thanks for everything and all the advice on where to go Avery, best service ever!

-xkm8SWKltO3z6OaAgzVng.text: This place is alright. Nothing special about the atmosphere but good food and the usual slew of drinks. Taco Tuesdays is a great deal--$2/taco. And I think I went on a Thursday night one time and it was two for one drinks which is crazy good. I typically like places with a little more personality but this is a decent deal/scene.

oxkDt0CKtV5kCsGpQEVKfw.text: My girl Veronica is the best bartender/server I have ever had in my life. I was in last Tuesday and she was most welcoming person and overall great person I have ever had in the hospitality industry. She made me want to come back and live it up at Devils Advocate!

uNJKnusNM_815Epc0aTD6w.text: Food is real good & they have a descent variety of beers.  Waitress was real nice; I have no complaints.    I only gave it four stars, instead of five because of my own preferences; which has nothing to do with their service or quality of food, just preference.  If you like fun & local college type bars, you will love this place!

ukBl4waIeiWJ_Ux9ZmCIuA.text: The food was great, have to give them that. The service however was awful. We had to ask for a menu first of all. Then never got our waters refilled. She never checked on us after we got our food. Oh and she lied straight to our face. We asked her to check on the food because it was taking forever and one out of two people already had their order. She walked around the bar, came back and said the kitchen is just busy it'll be right out, as another waiter walked to our table behind her with our order... it's taco Tuesday but the service shouldn't be this bad.

IDYA2Xzt9SNrg3SlIJ-Qfw.text: we were a party of 8 @ 8:00am getting ready for the world cup Final. we had some drinks and some food, it was ok but ill have to go again and revisit at regular hours since i think they were understaffed and wait time for anything was long

EQzEmF7IvAjQYhmf5oZRxw.text: Let's talk the worst customer service ever! I tried calling to place an order and left on hold for several minutes. I was in the area and decided I'll just go inside and place my order. Once, I got inside I was never greeted. They have no uniforms and you can't even tell who actually works there. I stood at the bar for minutes before I was ever approached. The girls that work there are too busy socializing, focused on how they look and playing with their hair to even notice they have customers. Finally, when I get service I am trying to tell her my order and she is walking away making drinks. But, she keeps telling me she is listening. I tried to explain to her that last week my wings were uncooked and they me wrong items in my bag. Did she even hear me no?! Because, she was too busy socializing and playing around with her coworkers. We waited over 30 minutes for our food. I was never told estimated time when my order would be out. This guys comes at the kitchen and basically throws my bag of food at us when it's finally ready. This is what made me write this review that took me over the edge. I added extra sauces at the end of my order. I paid with my debit card and I did not want to charge $1.08 on my card. I left a $1.10 in change and as I am walking out the door he is yelling smart comments . I turned around and said that was for the sauces. I already tipped her! It's a persons choice to tip or not. Even, with the poor customer service I still left her something. It wasn't much and we tipped her the other day as well. I will never go to Devil's Advocate again in my life!

db9ncn4eRXjgxTMYs3Cefw.text: I love Devil's Advocate, and I will ALWAYS go there on Thursdays, but tonight was just ridiculous. I love the 2for1 drinks and usually the music is great, but tonight the DJ was absolutely ridiculous. I go to Devils Advocate to listen to my favorite songs, but tonight it was just so much EDM with a few songs in between. I dont know who the new DJ is, but he definitely isn't a favorite and I heard plenty of complaints all night. We ended up leaving before 12:30 am!   Again, I love Devil's Advocate! One of my favorite bars! The bartenders and security guards are absolutely phenomenal and I get nothing but great service there whenever I go! But the music is absolutely what makes the mood, and tonight, the mood was pretty dead. I'm sure the only reason people actually stayed was to take advantage of the 2 for 1 drinks.

IIh0leZTwg_R9ZCtVXok-g.text: Great little college bar. They have a good list of happy hour drinks and food choices. They even have events on certain days of the week such as trivia night. Nothing amazing about it but can't find anything to complain. They also have quite a bit of parking In the back which is unusual for being that close to a college campus.

suu6uhRBRw6Dvbx9vU6CWA.text: Went in last night and it was terrible. It wasn't busy yet it took 5 minutes for anyone to come to our table for a drink order. I ordered the fish and chips and was so upset when it came out. Over cooked is an understatement! They were dark brown and hard as a rock! I am in the industry so I didn't want to complain but as a server if you see someone hasn't eaten any of their food maybe you should ask if everything is ok not just if they want a box! I paid for my crappy food, didn't eat dinner and went on with my night. Definitely won't be going back!

64_sh_qRGauTPols-jpJMg.text: My wife and I stop by for a late night visit and they had Trivia Night going on.  The Trivia was well run, and fun to listen to (we didn't play).  We ordered the wings and they were AMAZING!  we tried four different styles and they were all delicious.  So glad we stopped in.

tgzTAet9OoyUz838x4M3JQ.text: Okay everyone I have a few keys points I wish to focus on in this posting. Food quality, service, and the people.  Food quality has been 8/10 most of the time. The tacos on taco tuesday are the reason I come back to this place every week. Tacos range from $1-$2.50 and for being a college student that is a taco that I can afford. Not only is it cheap, but it tastes DELICIOUS too. The only problem with the tacos is that there is always a  solid chunk that manages to fall out. But maybe its the myself and not the taco LOL.   P.s. try the carnitas taco, you won't regret it  Service has usually been relatively quick and I am never waiting for an extreme amount of time for food or drinks. Staff has always been very friendly and accommodating to myself and friends. I look foward to my next experience at Devil's Advocate.   By the way if you are having drink during happy hour rum and gin well drinks are $2.50 ;)

ZxyITILdCV9J7U8zH-Vamw.text: The place was cool. We had the zucchini chips and they were fabulous! Breading was amazing. I ordered the Sante Fe chicken and was very pleased with it. My hunny ordered the street tacos and he loved them. The only fall back was our waitress. Super slow service. When we needed refills we had to go to the bar and get them.. low and behold she's there eating dessert. No problem but she was missing FOREVER! When it came to check out again we couldn't find her. Great food hopefully better service next time we go

qwj71VMdbePUKRzZSYrRPA.text: Dear Riley,   (Or at least I think that's your name, since it was listed as server on the receipt.)   I did not appreciate how you spent the whole time my two friends and I were on the patio at Devil's Advocate, going out of your way to make us feel unwelcome. I did not like that you rushed our drink order, even before you dropped off the drink menu, and after we had to flag you down for service. I did not appreciate the attitude we got from you after we finished our 2nd round of drinks and wanted to hold off on the next. We had half a basket of food, some of which were on their way to our mouths, so no, we do not want our check just yet. It was unnecessary to take my napkins as I was still eating. Were they in your way?  You know, being unused and all? And it was ridiculously rude to clear our drinks, as we're sitting there,  still talking, after we just paid.  Maybe I didn't notice the non-existent line of people waiting for our table.  That's my bad. And if you felt I was rude for commenting that I wasnt done with my water just yet, as you're trying to shoo us out the door, I'm sorry.  Your insincere apology was duly noted.  I guess I didn't know that you guys ran a restaurant/bar where people left more annoyed than when they came in.  It's def one way to run a business. I'm sure many other places can take a note or two on how to make a patron feel unwelcome from you guys! Hope that strategy works for you in the long run! The only thing I do regret though, is tipping you more than 15%. If I weren't in the industry myself, you would have gotten nothing.   I honestly hope you were just having a bad day.  And that the ill treatment resulted from nothing more than that. If this is the norm though,  I'm surprised you guys have any customers at all.    Thanks, though! Tonight was memorable.  But I wouldn't do it again.

photos.caption: Photo of Devil's Advocate - Tempe, AZ, United States. My only regret is tipping 2.50 on a 14.50 tab after being treated that way.  What a dumb.

v7Na1oqflYmA8ELQFfs9iw.text: Delicious food and great wings. Happy hour has a great beer special and staff is very good.

TrpWvCLySQA6yl78l-aHXA.text: For a bar that I haven't been to in literally 24 years (back when it was Maloney's), it was nice to check this place out. The service was slow and it wasn't very busy. We had a few drinks. A lot has changed in the near two and a half decades.

OO2yXvm7gUS9IYtJBG7Dmg.text: Typical college sports bar. I like the casual environment here and of course the nice sized patio. I'm always in search of a good patio bar for people watching. Food is so so and services are hit and miss. I will be back for hanging out.

uiwE6v3FVS2iGfiZHyk2zQ.text: I LOVE Devil's! I swear I go every Tuesday for taco Tuesday because their tacos are the BEST! Basically all of them are a dollar except their shrimp tacos. The shrimp tacos are so worth it though! The service is usually pretty good, but it could be improved on. The girls always try to remember my order and most of the time it ends up being wrong because of that, but the food is so good that it makes up for it.

-5ED-1IzNuf4ymvwYVFosw.text: Came here for taco Tuesday! Got a bean taco and the Mac n cheese one. Both were good not great. Wish they had more options. Feel like you can only take a few bites of the Mac and cheese one before you are just over it. Also, service wasn't great at all.

CYol-z1b2RJDKUgjuK0JDQ.text: Had devils Advocate for the first time tonight. If there was a way to give this business no stars I would. Food is way undercooked and the chicken wings were raw on the inside. Same with the chicken strips. This place is poor quality and should be concerned about making it's customers sick. Very disappointed in this place and was excited to try a new place in Tempe. With so many options in Tempe please do yourself a favor and skip this place. Horrible food. Don't waste your money at this place.

R7yVj0iFdDx0N_ha_vQ4Jg.text: I moved to Tempe almost two years ago and after discovering Devil's about a couple months in this bar/grill has become my favorite spot to relax and hangout with friends and family bar none! I have a keen eye for  quality of restaurants as I myself have worked in the food service industry coming up on ten years in serving positions and management. The  staff at Devil's Advocate is amazingly friendly and attentive. I've never had a wrong food order come out and never have been dissapointed with the quality or taste of the food. Their happy hour prices are UNRIVALED and they always pour a strong drink.   In addition to the exceptional prices, atmosphere, and staff they have every sports game you can imagine available to enjoy on their tvs located anywhere your eye can wonder inside and on the patio. They have strong misters on the patio as well to keep you cool in the unforgiving AZ sun. Ive been here 20+ times and have never been let down. If you have never been in to Devil's stop reading this review and get down there asap! (:

Jr7Xc_PvZ8abTvrDSKbQ3Q.text: Gooooo Devils!!!!!!! =)  I came here for the first time with a friend for happy hour. He said they have pretty good specials and everything was half off. I got the happy hour menu and ordered the Devils Island. Beware when drinking this! It's like a long island but better and extremely strong!   I also ordered the nachos which were pretty good. I really liked the melted cheese that they used. It was quite yummy.   I'm giving this place a 3 star because the happy menu is quite confusing. It gives you a list of items of food happy hour items, then on the back is the drink menu. However, those drinks were NOT on happy hour. So apparently mine was not. My friend ordered a regular long island and the waitress didn't even know if it was on happy hour or not. Seems like she wasn't very knowledgeable of the happy hour menu. If you go to their website they have an entirely different happy hour menu. It's quite confusing.   I think it's a really good place to hang out with friends for a drink or watch the game. I really liked my drink and nachos. I'd come back, but I definitely think they need to create a better happy hour menu for their customers and their staff needs to be more knowledgeable with it..

PqO5QWTP5hknHv2_B4nl1g.text: This place has good bar food, okay service. Good place to come watch a game they have tons of tvs and a full bar w rotating beers on tap. I would recommend the Black and bleu burger or their wings!

bcQx7Or3Kr0Jb2pjCHz0sg.text: Went there for Taco Tuesday last night and talk about a great deal! They have $1 taco, chicken, steak and carnitas. Wow they are good. You do have to have a beverage purchase, but they also have $2 Mexican drafts, so it's a great deal all around!  There was also a live band playing as well. Bartenders are always very friendly and outgoing.

QqyWmeCzg92Z_IrGtsLY9A.text: The new place looks great and tastes even better! Even though it is bar food, it is excellent bar food! Try the sweet potato fries, their spinach artichoke pizza, or their spicy pineapple wings! Good stuff. The staff is friendly and accommodating.

That was very considerate and will create more business for you!  Happy new year!!!  This place is great if you love unattentive, lazy, worthless bartenders. With four deadbeats behind the bar and only 10 people actually at the bar it should take less than 10 minutes to get a drink, not the case.  The waitress are little better.  The band  rocked!  Some dude puked right in the front dead center of the bar and everybody bailed off that end, these four genius'  had no idea.   It took almost 15 minutes before anyone even wiped the bartop muchless the floor which took another 10...  Suck..  but the band rocked!  Kung fu grip rules! Don't let this go to your heads boys but you suck as bartenders, stick to the roids.  Lazy and lame.

C1a33KHB_3hR4AJXRTpPhw.text: cool setup inside... get here early if you plan on coming to watch a game and want somewhere to sit. it gets very busy...and you will be shit outta luck when it comes to finding somewhere to plop your ass... other than that cool little spot!

2hv-IbQt-IRo-k721AYU9w.text: Awesome bar. Plus Kendra gave me free food aand I got to watch Boston kill Vancouver for the Stanley Cup finals. Yay!

EyBkcQovpOSlpBgoe3J_DQ.text: I really liked this place, the food is very similar to applebee's or chilli's but I liked the food and atmosphere here a little better.  The portions were huge and the prices were dirt cheap.

ADD50GYluOFxi1i3v9mVrA.text: This is a great bar near ASU.  It's got a good feel inside and though it can get crowded it never feels packed inside.  It attracts students, but isn't grimey and dirty like some bars near college towns can be.  The service is always good and the food is decent for a bar.  This is a great place to meet friends and have a few drinks on the weekend or to catch the game.  I would give this place 5 stars but I went once on a Friday night and they were OUT of Bud Light.  Unacceptable.

Ier7ODbqNxn2z9K_RYNq4Q.text: Ask for Veronica (I think her name is?) Great service and very beautiful girl. Was very helpful with menu and had great energy. Highly reccommend the pizza.

IcRrTapphgm4GrDibZA1mA.text: Stopped in on Sunday to watch some football.  First time here, and we'll definitely be back.  The place itself has a great mix of patio as well as indoor/outdoor lighting.  Lots of different seating options, so that you can choose what is most comfortable to you, but all near a TV.  Great drink prices, not your usual weak pour that accompanies such prices, and our waitress was great.  She had the perfect balance of never making you wait, but also not hovering/making you feel pressured to hurry and order more.  That made us feel comfortable hanging out, stay longer/order more, and want to go back.  How come everyone doesn't get it?  We didn't eat, but the menu looked great. We can't wait to go back, try the food, and whatever that fun looking game thingy is on the side.

ZwjgRpagClFqFcgLCPZJ9Q.text: Thursday two for one drink specials! You can't beat that. But of course that comes with a grain a salt... it is packed with undergrads and the parking can fill up leaving you to park across the street at del taco. Fortunately the place is a good size and there are entertaining music videos that accompanies the super loud music.

vy-6tm4nv5UwsJjhhdf0bw.text: The food at Devils is surprisingly really good, defiantly surprised at the quality they had to offer. Although the service wasn't the best I've seen (as previous reviewers stated) their food and fun bar atmosphere definitely make up for it. Will absolutely be returning to devils this Sunday to watch the games!

ksKJK3Rm9BV9gopjdyktwQ.text: Comfortable chairs, plenty of room, NO COVER for UFC's. This place is good.

nZGk4IrmJFo50euPs4JcIw.text: This place is absolutely AMAZING! The food taste great and you get huge portions and the prices are lower than most places. It is very clean and has a comforting layout. It gets pretty packed at night with all of the ASU kids, so I enjoy going there for lunch or an early dinner so i can beat the crowd. They also have great drink specials and daily food specials as well. Overall, AWESOME place!

bL80QQMXRtRjoVkQytbAOw.text: Cool Sports Bar but the food was sub-par and Bland. Loved the Bloody Mary Bar but would not eat there again.

lWG3CGuNKdwLSAA-pySMcw.text: Reunited, and it feels so goooooddd! Best deals on booze in Tempe, great atmosphere, love the True Sun Devil feel with all of the posters and the "library"

lMcGDDNj-npzLnVu_rNKqw.text: I went to devil's with the intention of having a few drinks and heading to another bar, but the band playing on the patio (ska /rap/rock/awesome ) and overall fun atmosphere of the place kept my there 'til last call.

q8B8BZO3WeK7X49PdiKPbQ.text: Good sports bar to chill @ with a few friends..the crowd was huge Friday night.  The lady and I both approve..

FtpSYEeKI_wBUzfG49pVpA.text: Well, I think bartenders should be bartenders, most of the time patrons at the bar get neglected, they ran out of wings on Sunday lunch time $5 dollar special on football season, that's a No! NO! On my book, bartenders, touch their hairs, mouth, back for sweat, yuk! And touch appetizer plates and glasses after that's cross contaminations, other than that when we moved to the table service was better and food was good.

f5JPCNWliJN3nsn_ZQLBJQ.text: Our softball team usually goes here after the games on Monday nights and I love it here. Good specials during the nights, has shuffleboard and pool to keep you entertained . Plus, the waitresses are very good looking so that's a bonus! Only bad thing is that the food can come at a slow pace sometimes. There are TVs everywhere so it doesn't matter where you sit, you will always have a view at a good TV.

Y8BbcValv4CnYgYEcWqZ0A.text: Food's not bad, they have good drink specials too. Busiest night is definitely on Thursday nights when they have the two-for-one drink special. Only reason why I had to go 3 stars is cause the waitresses have overcharged me on drinks multiple times on Thursday nights. And when you try to confront them about it they get really bitchy cause it's always busy.

GBdgvn_IUwqSuXUmYCEQ8g.text: We live in the way Northwest Valley and don't go to Tempe often but we were at Tempe Town Lake for the JDRF walk and they handed out coupons and 25% of the proceeds were being donated, so we decided to try this place.  I can see how happy hour would be fun for college students.  The service and food weren't that great.  Considering we were the only people in there at 1045am, I thought they would be more attentive.  I had the Frisco burger which was way over cooked and dry.  I was surprised they didn't have a plain burger or even ask how I wanted mine cooked.  My husband had the chicken fingers which were amazing.  I ended up eating one of those because they were absolutely huge!  I would recommend those to anyone.  Our friend had the burger with the egg and onion rings and he said it was fantastic.  They do have a large selection of beer on tap and serve Coke products.  I don't think we would go back to eat, but maybe for happy hour drinks.

OIp9n7SmVsViBFXkCyBOSA.text: I would go back to your restaurant because of the ambiance and location.... But I was indirectly insulted by the server assigned to mine and my husbands table..... I manage a restaurant and I would not disrespect any of our clients.... You have to train your servers  that if its a couple especially a man & a Woman.... they have to at least ask the woman and serve the woman first... I don't know if your server is doing the trick to serve the guy first because they would tip more... ...IThere're a lot of reasons I can think of, of why she did such a move--- putting the appetizers way on the side of my husband,,, in front of him... What was I???--- Table was empty except for our drinks... So what was her reason..... to all the lady servers... you don't know who handles the checkbook   :)  So my advise is to just plain respect the woman if they are with a man..... I would have tipped more but I still gave the right amount of tip........

OkpAE7AOJoKS9aND4wnMAQ.text: Very nice! I had a great time here. The service is great & food is amazing! Had the bottomless mimosas I think it was til 2 pm or 3 pm, I forgot but I loved the taste of the mimosas. Also the vibrancy is enormous, outside is nice and inside is cool. Totally coming back here again!

Photo of Devil's Advocate - Tempe, AZ, United States

eWe9fQf_RMgy8rozmVdekA.text: Love it, I've been coming here for years. Menu got better even, I went back recently and their menu was always amazing, and they added even more stuff. I'm thrilled!! Amazing staff, great prices, close to ASU for games!!

RFTsmRLMcu55RAmdLt5YmQ.text: Flys all over our table inside, snot and blood all over the mens bathroom walls, and our food tasted like leftovers. I'm sorry I had very high hopes for this place as it looked very inviting from the outside. With all that said the only thing I suggest is driving by and looking at the plants that cover the buildings. But don't be fooled it is an absolute cesspool inside. Never ever again. Very tragic.

qLMgCw99HqEMjYO0fMQ4fg.text: Drinks are cheap during happy hour! They have specials everyday as well until closing! I ordered the mushroom Swiss burger with sweet potato fries and it was pretty good for $8! Cheap and good! I haven't tried other foods there yet but I can tell you that their portion of the food is great for the price! I would totally go back for food and drinks and hanging out with friends! Great spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Devil's Advocate - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mushroom Swiss Burger with sweet potato fries

kFkvep4pIfUvPaNA4_PWMQ.text: I was meeting a friend here 3 hours before an ASU game(which we weren't going to and didn't care about). He had already been there for a while with some other friends. I was going to stop in and have 1 drink with him there and then go elsewhere.   There was an employee guarding the parking lot and told us it would be $20 to park there. He said I would get my money back when I gave them the ticket when I cashed out.   I explained that I would only be having 1 drink which definitely wouldn't total $20. I asked if I would still get my whole $20 back and he said no. It wasn't at all like he explained it initially.   I'm not a college kid so I'm not willing to let a business rip me off more than usual just to have the privilege of eating in the same town as a football game that I don't care about.   I understand they probably don't care about my $6-10 tab being lost because they know that they can rip off dumb college kids all day for $20 a pop. The place wasn't really even close to being full though. It was 3 hours before the game. Your area isn't exactly a hotbed for tailgating.

L50xbXQOcncdA3D_Q8stMw.text: Great food and tacos, horrible service. It takes a lot for me to write this review but I honestly love their tacos but the service is so slow and rude it makes me not want to come back. I SO want that to change so this place can be successful and I can continue to come back for the food and good drinks. I've been coming for four years now and watched the waitresses sit down and eat/chat together on the clock instead of waiting on customers. Please serve well because I want to love this place again  Edit:  The owner contacted me directly and promptly, and promised to take care of the situation. I would call that great customer service, maybe just needs a bit more coaching for the service staff. The review now reflects the outstanding efforts of the owners.

d9BLljD7Ojdz2sHoxnEKMw.text: Service is kinda rude. Not worth coming here unless on a Thursday night where you get two for one drinks.

quEoV2iLHoxoSVjn-s5Qpg.text: The Dj is terrible on Thursday's! Need someone with a better variety of music! Not no dam EDC garbage. Nobody dances to it .

NVtmHA-r8wHPfkknt_2tSQ.text: Terrible service and the food was not much better. Definitely will not be coming back.

__q19Zh7ovF-R1qe4Ez1yw.text: Had such a enjoyable experience at taco Tuesday RUSSEL  was so nice and helpful what a great guy we come here often and it's quite nice meeting someone so awesome and helpful he really made our experience

uS259DMCG8zAHVk2KWnS-w.text: A friend and I stopped here to eat dinner before an ASU basketball game. We arrived an hour and fifteen minutes before the game began. We were greeted immediately by a waittress, but then she did not return. After about fifteen minutes, we went to the bar to order drinks. When our drinks finally arrived, the order was incorrect. We waited to order dinner, and after a half hour, realized we did not have time to eat. We tried to order a quick appetizer, then waited another half hour and it never came. Our incorrect drink order was never corrected. Finally, we had to leave without eating, because it was time for the game to begin.  What bothered me most about this situation is that the wait staff could have cared less about the problem. Nobody apologized, or did anything to help us out.

9k-rov5v0jagmfvkR7mV_g.text: My reviews are usually longer, but there isn't much to say here. This place is closely, and and i don't go there enough. I have only ordered one thing off the menu, so i would recommend the FRISCO to anyone. That keeps me going back, and please give it a try. The atmosphere is casual, and i like the chairs at the bar. They are like chairs you would have at your house. Super comfortable to sit and watch a game, or hang with friends. It kinda sucks while eating, but if you get the Frisco you won't even care. Service has always been good and i have no complaints. Highly recommend.

D-t3el4EYrrHlcjc554s0Q.text: Great spot to socialize and grab few drinks. Best days to come are Thursdays since they have 2x1 promotions.  Mainly customers are ASU students (as the name implies). Comfortable place to hang out with friends.  Food here is good. (For bar food). Quesadillas with your meat choice are the bomb though.

photos.caption: Photo of Devil's Advocate - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Devil's Advocate - Tempe, AZ, United States. Menu :)

o5qBrej5VKiSzL42PU_YMQ.text: I was desperate looking for a place to watch some football games this past Sunday and i made the mistake to stop in. I should have known what kind of place this was when there were way too many seats open at kick off times. I ordered a beer and then I finally got it. I placed an order of "chips and salsa" and 20 minutes later still no chips and salsa.  Then it was kick off time and with over 30 tv monitors and over 10 different football games going on, the Cardinals were showing on every monitor. other games finally were turned on after doing some begging.  30 minutes later and still no chip and salsa! the young waitress was totally clueless and with the first day of the football season they only had 1 bartender!  My recommendation is to never go in there to watch a game or for any other reason!

Ck60wibQOeMGVdzImuh1Fw.text: In response to Steven M. Michael is the guy guarding the parking lot, and he is just guarding the parking lot and doing his job. For as crowded as it was, the staff did a really good job.  Michael, it was great to meet you. And Steven, if you are going to go out on game day,you better plan on paying for parking; or at least plan on it being crowded.

XQaa5OOvfmH5xZ0ZFMVNow.text: Good beer deals. Great game day bar with plenty of TVs and good music. Ordered the beer battered chicken strips and got them dipped in Mango Habanero sauce. Fries are great!

mtm8Ocz4Nb5zTEn-makY_Q.text: Worst service ever!  Privileged little b-----! That waited on is was useless, clueless and rude. Manager stood at bar and  bs'ing with one customer the whole time we were there. The star is for the good food! Great job cooks, wish i could rate you a 5star separately.  Will never go back!

5eaw4LbuqElYMOWfnqCJfQ.text: Checked out this joint on my quest to find best bar around. It's not bad at all actually ... the other reviews about "go for Taco Tuesday" is spot on. I had two tacos and a Dos Equis - $5.95 ... you cannot beat that price.  The tacos were actually above decent, so much so that I ordered another one after finishing the first round. It is a college bar, but there was a fantastic mix of people - students, locals, bikers, professionals.  The service was good (I sat at the bar) - it was busy by there were lots of follow ups and refills by the bar staff.
