Photo of Devil's Advocate - Tempe, AZ, United States. The view form the outside deck !

QxN4CQjgard9hgKCObwyLQ.text: Went in for taco Tuesday and thought I had been poisoned. Spent a solid two day on the can from this food. Also had to wait like 20 minutes for a beer, so service is wack. The place had a cool vibe at first, but the service dragged it down

zdP5Ws1iAxYKmXE-xUSCTw.text: Bartender with the super long blonde hair couldn't stay off her phone long enough to take an order. Had to flag her down a d she only followed up with males I had to have a friend correct my drink order. I get better drinks and service on Mill Ave.

PggYkFtLWU0hgYa1arS6vQ.text: Just went here to watch the Steeler game.  This place has a good atmosphere for watching sports.  Plenty of tv screens, with multiple games going on at the same time.  You can pick your seat next which game you want to watch.  I ate the BLTA sandwich.  Plenty of bacon, nice and crispy the way I like it.  Toast just a bit too crunchy.  Onion rings on the side were delicious.  Also, tried the sweet potato fries which were very good as well.  Waitress was attentive, refilling drinks and checking in on our table.  I would go back to this bar.  Bill for four people was 36 bucks.  That was for 2 meals, a side of wings, 3 beers and several soft drinks.

VjPaKxbeZh4fkw9s7gd2nA.text: I've always wanted to stop in here but never got the chance. I finally checked it out last night after work. They always have something going on here. Wednesday they have karaoke and Sunday they have trivia. Thursdays are two for one drinks and its packed. They also have drink specials every day. We were starving so we ordered a pizza, burger, and wings (the wings were $5 on Sunday). It was all delicious but way too much food. We ended up taking at least half of it home. The service was great. The bartender had great suggestions and was on top of things without being annoying. We are looking forward to going here again for karaoke or trivia!

KkPanVlxtpsuG0V0IlEchg.text: My favoite sports bar by far. I can't think of one thing I don't like. The foods awesome, the drinks are innexpensive, they've got deals every day, and the waitresses are extremely friendly.  If you're looking for a place to hang out, watch the game, or have a great night, I'd definitely say go here. Every time.

BZi8LRptQPToslvM1FLDCQ.text: This place was really cool and I loved going. I THOUGHT it was buy 1, get 1 drinks but appreantly not. I asked for 2  Bud Lights thinking because of the deal I would get 4 but I got 2 and was charged $4.50. IDk

HReGoqVk4eDqfKB5U1VqQA.text: Collage bar w a good vibe, adequate seating and lots if alcohol. Wings are good, the blue cheese is bomb...

fl3f4FTYiS320aNFR_tSJQ.text: well the owner contacted me, apologized, and offered for me to come in and give it another try on him.....I declined because I knew it wouldn't be a real second chance for his staff to treat me as a valued customer, they would know to expect me. I may return some time again, will report back then.

rIM_2gOmV9tseIC2E3O5vQ.text: Devils advocate is a great college bar. It can also be a welcome break from Mill Ave.  the staff is friendly and easy in the eyes.  They have good drink and food specials almost every night of the week.  Some highlights include BOGO burgers on Monday, dollar tacos on Tuesday, and 241 drinks on Thursday.  Check it out and you won't be disappointed!

WOY4NewAZnX-B9U5qMfXdQ.text: I am really hard to please and I was very impressed. The remodel is great. There are lots of different areas inside and outside where you can enjoy all the TVs and music. I love the food, the service was outstanding and I really liked the books all over the place. I can see myself hanging here a lot.

m8i6G9h-DtH0iW_i_x4sPQ.text: Thursday night was my first and last time going to devil's advocate Bar and Grill. I met up with some friends to get drinks on a 2for1 night (which was dope!), The atmosphere was just as good as the drink specials. My issue was with the staff. After the bar closed at 2AM, one of the bouncers/security-guys got into an argument with a gentleman that was a little too intoxicated. One of the security guys kept escalating the situation and right as the cops were rolling up to check out the commotion, the security decided to take it a step further and tell the drunk man to "get the fuck out of here you fucking nigger!" I know that doesn't represent your business as a whole, but the other security guys seemed pretty chill with him blurting that out while everyone else around shook their head in dismay. As a black man, I'm not going to spend my  money at a business that hires scum like that. It's college town and the crowd was pretty diverse that night I was there with hip hop being played as well. There's no reason to have people working at your establishment,  that are supposed to act in a professional manner, calling people racial slurs. This was on Thursday 1/12 (technically 1/13 since it was 2AM).

kvUsl_GHM1nRF8Iz1t9COQ.text: I love this place. It's the closest bar within walking distance to me and I take advantage of that! They have good deals on Thursday nights and it gets packed on the patio. I usually see people I know from school or around town from time to time here. The staff is pretty good. I usually have good service. I like the Aloha Chicken sandwich or the Hawaiian pizza with a tall Blue Moon. They also have big flat screen tv's for football games!

bhHf4s24ghoe84qD5NmvPQ.text: A solid "college bar".  Good specials, and lots of fun stuff to occupy your time while you drink (such as shuffle board.)  Nice patio with TVs and a good number of seats. The bar is not a very efficient shape, but a small negative among many positives.

p2t4_RdyBM4gBbwNs9km7Q.text: another college bar, just away from Mill but still the same old. Cheap drinks on Thursday. Music is ok, the parking lot is fantastic and if you want to avoid running into your students, better check somewhere else.

BbFyTxcn9gVEgrGYgR9u0Q.text: Love this place! They make great long island ice tea (my favorite!) and have great prices.

vL3J9UZyqwGB3LF8mfUCxg.text: This place is good for meeting people for happy hour or going out with a group. Drinks range from cheap to reasonable in price and they have a good selection of beers and liquor (tough luck if you have high-class wine taste). If you're hungry, they have a good-sized menu that's much better than your average bar fare.  On a side note, this place is great for day drinking: $1 Bud/Miller/Coors Lights before 4:00.

7AICYJr1p_nvBbU_loHfvw.text: Great service, food & drinks!  Best college bar in Tempe by far!

FAnUYl0-03pI5dw0TEFSbg.text: Great happy hour deals. $4.50 for a giant, nearly pitcher sized beer, solid appetizers, and good food. Lots of TV's, and a pool table or two. The only issue we had was the lack of table seating. For such a large building it seemed like there weren't that many tables. The bar takes up half of the floor space.

3q1y7v5SgAvIK5dADceuOg.text: It's aright, if I can't get one of those big chairs at the bar, I'll go somewhere else. I do have to say they for bar food, you get quite a bit of food, but it's only good after a few beers if you know what I'm saying.

fCeDL4lMIOKZua-PyrU7Zw.text: love this place great happy hour and friendly staff and perfect to watch sports

nby6XJ2Z3Ab9EDXc-yl-GQ.text: Good burgers and apps.  the service is pretty good and the place has a special all the time.  I think everything is 1/2 price until 7!  Even when that ends they have something special.  Between the billion TV's and cheap booze I'm a fan.

TDiUk9arKjeU570dfdmiDA.text: Nice place good food I would recommend anyone wanting to watch the game a lot of T.V's lot's off Specials

mCd7GSHyrMetqF9nWE-9eQ.text: Taco Tuesday!!! I always search for the best price tacos on tuesdays. Devil's Advocates has surpassed my expectations for their $1 tacos (few other tacos reasonable priced $1.50-$2.50). Better quality and value than any other taco place I have been to ever before!  In addition, they have awesome deals on Mexican beers and well margaritas (on Tuesday).   They have daily specials as well, visit their website to check out their happy hour and daily specials.   They have TV's playing sports and other entertainment.  Great place to meet other people.  There are nice comfy chairs by the bar (only like 8 or 9 of them) as well as a patio that is dog friendly.  I have no complaints about this place. Its one of my favorite spots and has been for the past year.

photos.caption: Photo of Devil's Advocate - Tempe, AZ, United States. Taco Tuesday with dollar tacos
Photo of Devil's Advocate - Tempe, AZ, United States. Taco Tuesday and breakfast menu

djHQBt4zy-ps5SBBRpzUBQ.text: This is a very college-y bar that attracts a lot of college-aged people. The main takeaway from that is the drinks are really cheap! My pint of craft beer was $3.50. The beer menu has changed over the years but I have always been pleased by the variety of local brews.   They do trivia every Wednesday evening (it used to be run by Geeks Who Drink but in the past year it changed to Team Trivia). On Thursdays they have a two for one drink special after 8 pm and it gets super packed with college kids. Personally I prefer the more low-key trivia night but if you're more of a party person you'll probably like this place on Thursdays.   I did not get any food this time and it's been a while since I have actually ordered food here, but I don't really remember it, so it must not have been memorable. It is basically standard bar food options.  Parking is surprisingly very accessible despite being so close to ASU. There is a lot of parking in the back and I've never had to stress about it.

DQ-3XQQpj9_8cRU3tZd0aw.text: Great Taco Tuesday find! Been wanting to check this place out and today I saw they had a good Taco Tuesday deal (anywhere from $1 to $2.50 per taco) with purchase of any beverage. The tacos were really good - the Mac and cheese one and the portobello mushroom ones were definitely my favorite. The tortillas were soft and for the price, the portions were generous. Our server was really friendly and attentive and the food came out quickly. The place itself has an interesting aesthetic - it felt like  a college bar that was trying to be a quiet adult bar, but in the middle of the day on a Tuesday when we went, it was a good atmosphere. Will definitely be back to try some other specials - their happy hour menu looks great!

photos.caption: Photo of Devil's Advocate - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Devil's Advocate - Tempe, AZ, United States. Taco Tuesday menu! (Beverage purchase required)

zlUi69RRKLKDNn4fqLtrMw.text: Amazing place with an amazing vibe! The food is amazing and flavorful. The service is prompt and nice too as they don't stand on your head and give your your space and time at the same time you don't feel neglected. There is ample parking space. Good option for vegetarians too. We opted for the patio seating on the 4th of July and enjoyed the view of fireworks while eating good food and great beer. My husband and I had a very beautiful evening here. Thank you guys!

photos.caption: Photo of Devil's Advocate - Tempe, AZ, United States. El Diablo burger with vegetarian patty &amp; Sweet Potato Fries
Photo of Devil's Advocate - Tempe, AZ, United States. Oak creek - buy 1 get 1

vchugsHvTk8NNtQDgw6eow.text: My favorite go to bar anytime I'm in Tempe!  Great Happy Hour! Love the atmosphere on any day of the week. Bloody Mary's are always great on a Sunday, while you catch a football game in the fall.

x7ZXksmH15dQgrEkBv3-_A.text: It's a great place but food is not as good as it could be.  Had a philly steak sandwich and it was greasy.  Tater tots tasted a little funky too

DgkE68EwDUw5GWCgp0S0wQ.text: After 3 years at ASU, I finally went to devil's for the first time. I'm currently kicking myself because I'm upset that I've been missing out on cheap drinks and food!  We came on a Friday night and there was reverse happy hour starting at 10. Before 10, they were still having normal Friday drink specials! $5 vodka and $5 jack and coke!  We were meeting up with some family and had a group of 7 people so we definitely took advantage of the specials.   I also ordered the buffalo fries and they were so good. I subbed the blue cheese for ranch no problem and everyone at the table couldn't keep their hands to themselves so we ended up having to order a 2nd batch! Yum. :)   Skylar did an awesome job serving us and being an awesome sport. My uncle and cousins were definitely having a really good time joking with her and embarrassing me, but she was such an awesome server and had a great attitude. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Devil's Advocate - Tempe, AZ, United States

bXwe3UMx9lng-r-vX4xeug.text: Just came to this bar and asked the waitress what the specials were when we came in and she failed to tell us that there were 2 dollar drinks, we got charged the regular bucket drink price and the owner wouldn't honor the 2 dollar drink price  even after his staff didnt inform us of the specals. Environment is great but not happy with management not honoring their specials. Buyer beware!!! . 2 dollar special happy hour should be honored during happy hour!!

8_-wOaTJMzLJDPWLCPu6sw.text: Was a great evening of drinking and banter until the end of the night. After we had all closed our respective tabs and half hour table went home, the waitress accused us of having more to pay on our table's tab. The mananger came out and interrogated us until we showed them physical and electronic receipts, and even them had me re-sign for my payment after I had signed for it 30+ minutes ago. She told me "please be more respectful to the waitress next time." Not once were any single one if us disrespectful. Your baseless accusations don't fly free here, and after your accusation I absolutely had to write this up on yelp. I didn't enjoy leaving this restaurant with this terribly sour experience.

Ib5Z1iujuMnVU0X-voV2mg.text: You NEVER tell a customer to "calm down"! Instead of apologizing she started to argue with me, we left. Out 1st and LAST time in there.

k6_-XXf3mf_oe3SNmEHsbg.text: Terrible service even when it's dead and happy hour. Waited at the bar for about 5-10 minutes with no service. Decided to switch to a high top table in the bar area thinking we'd get better service but NO! 3 waitresses including one behind the bar and still had to yell across the bar for our check because NOT ONCE were we checked on. 6/18/18 about 4:00pm Victoria was our server  RIDICULOUS

Cl80EOcQXwrKKuFQG7EjEA.text: Read a lot of negative reviews but had a good meal and some nice beers.  A buddy and I were there for Taco Tuesday and each had 3 tacos.  Very filling and very tasty!  Great service!

rAjW6Cxcl_Eu2JKApsq-8Q.text: Great place to catch a game. The staff is all about ASU and they are involved in promoting the community. Love the staff, it's like a big family. They know all the regulars and make everyone feel welcome. The portobello taco is my favorite on Tuesdays and the beer is COLD...... Check out the Happy Hour deals.

juRYBs4-9PLj7veZ06b0wg.text: We tried Devil's Advocate recently and weren't  terribly impressed. The service, was poor, and very limited. The servers were much more attentive to certain patrons...We ordered a couple beers and nachos. Nachos are usually a pretty safe thing to order, usually! The cheese was reminiscent of velveeta (if that's your jam, go for it!) Overall very bland and cold.    Most definitely an ASU bar!..

tgYl0xgdHSLqwHg1ES2NBA.text: My first visit to Devil's Advocate was amazing!!! Definitely a great place to watch sports hangout with friends go on a date. It was taco Tuesday so why not order tacos !!! I tried a Baja fish taco very tasty. It is a deep fried fish but was breaded very lightly. Hands down the best part is they have a portobello mushroom taco! Maybe it was my lucky day but wow who ever cooked that mushroom did a fantastic job. I also had a pork taco it wasn't my favorite but was still tasty. Lastly I had chicken green chili rolls tasty chicken but I personally would want more green chili. I think they had cheese in it as well I couldn't tell but that definitely was perfect for me. My friend had the pretzel   was warm fresh and there cheese sauce was yummy. I wish I took pictures but I guess for $1 to $2 for tacos why would I waste time eating them. Great happy hour drinks as well!!!

fy3I56hl0nvv_gYHibrrDw.text: Came here with a few friends for the ASU game tonight. The service was impeccable, the staff was very friendly, and the atmosphere was electric for the game. I got a chicken wrap tonight that was one of the best I've ever had at any bar hands on. I'll be coming here for all ASU games from now on.   If you're an ASU fan who likes cold beers, great food, and incredible service this is the place for you!

NekooS1wuzS5fuJ9VE5YFg.text: Came in with some of my friends on a Sunday evening. Place has an okay atmosphere. Waitresses are friendly and come to the table frequently. The waitress we had however, had no idea what the drink specials were or what was on tap. I ordered nachos and at first was disappointed at how little the plate was. However, they had good taste but were still a little spendy for the amount of nachos you actually get.

photos.caption: Photo of Devil's Advocate - Tempe, AZ, United States. Nachos

0CshCFJT6wB-gB0PFaswag.text: Devil's... the place my younger ASU grad friends have raves about as "the" ASU bar! Conveniently located walkable-close to my neighborhood. I set up a nice Friday evening happy hour with a large group of friends with management's help. I asked for a few tables to reserve and they gave us the entire left side of the bar/restaurant area! Our servers were great, from the mass arrival of most of my friends, all the way til our group had been whittled down a few hours labor to just one table. There was a creeper around our group (oh happy day, before their PM security arrived) and the staff made sure to keep an eye on him until he left and drove away. Not much of a damper on our time.  Although they don't outwardly announce Friday happy hour prices, they have them 3p-7p. Your typical (carbolicious) bar food fare, mix of local and national beers, and well drinks. After a few rounds and some food, I spent roughly $30 on myself. Looks like they broadcast a variety of local and national sports too but especially heavy on the Sun Devils!

8uNFv2-4SH2bixyapqakPg.text: **Edited to reply to the Manager** *After receiving a response to my comment on Yelp, I took the time to reply to the manager through email on March 26th. My email detailed exactly why I'd written my review in the way I had and gave a further description of the waitress who'd taken our money. To clarify: I am not blaming this restaurant for the difficulty their patrons have with turning out of the bar, I am simply warning people who may come here to cautious when leaving the premises. My rating was based solely on what occurred within Devil's Advocate.   As of today, April 6th, I have no received a response from the Manager.*   There's something sketchy going on with the staff.   The best thing about this place is price and the worst is their service. Parking isn't awful, but turning west out of the parking lot is a nightmare. I only come here when we're looking for the diviest place in town, and this place always delivers.   Service: THIS was the problem. We had a middle-aged blonde serving us on a Friday night. Service was slow, and our waitress unfriendly. The worst part by far however, was her change giving ability. We had two bills at our table, and she managed to not only round down the change, but had shorted each of us a dollar. I ended up with $7 change after giving a $20 for a $11.39 bill.   I was not drunk enough to miss this. I didn't bring it up because it wasn't a big enough issue that night. Let's be clear: I would've given the waitress that dollar, and more, as a tip. It was nevertheless, a little presumptive of her to just take it.   Food: their bar food is alright. It's nothing to right home about, but they will guarantee you as much grease and carbs as your wallet and stomach can afford. The sweet potato fries are a favorite, as are their wings. Beer prices are cheap.   Moral of this story: don't expect a lot, and pay with a credit card. You won't get your change.

-Amk17AehITdXj4FEQA_4g.text: Sat outside, the weather was actually nice, we appreciated the misters to be on! Made the patio welcoming. Our server Veronica is ( and had always been) always enjoyable to be around, takes the time to chat and remembers our order almost every time. We definitely like the good old DA

3Oxc8Qz567dL13WbnZDqpg.text: Great bar, the cheese sticks are awesome. Great Sunday specials and wonderful service. The bar is very clean and we loved our visit.

orVPaSGr2n_ylfruOWHMiA.text: This place is GREAT! $1 beer/$3 Smirnoff specials every day - killer food specials ($1 tacos, 2f1 pizza, 2f1 burgers, etc.) as well! Bailey is one of the best servers (and all around best person) ever ... what more do you want?!

wNbjsEvXJubuqTQ7ckvSSQ.text: Most people really like this place but I can't say I'm a fan. The food is pretty good and they have decent prices on drinks but I've had some pretty poor service when I've been there. I'm never one to complain about service but it has always been very slow and on one occasion the server told us the wrong happy hour prices and we ended up being charged way more than we were told. Maybe I've just had bad luck here but personally I have not been too impressed.

4ZFRTVPRWWesF7zfNI0Yug.text: I've driven past this place a trillion times, and when my boyfriend suggested we watch one of the bowl games the other night, this place popped into my head. We were there on a Monday night and it wasn't very packed, just a few parties here and there. The place is very well kept and looks really nice. I described it to my friend as a "classy sports bar".   Anyways, me and the boy grabbed a table and since I hadn't had dinner yet, I ordered the chicken rolls and some fries and he just had the pretzels. It was happy hour which was a plus, but the prices weren't outrageous to begin with. The description for the chicken rolls on the menu sounds far better than what they currently are (the server pointed out the change before I ordered them). They weren't terrible or anything, just pretty "meh" I guess. The fries were good though and they came in a huge tin. And my bf seemed to enjoy his pretzels. We had a few drinks while we were there, and there were plenty of tvs with various games on.   I can imagine when school in session how crazy busy this place is, but the business is well deserved.

PePraBok27XHOGq1g3cSIg.text: Met up with some friends for his birthday. We had a blast the bartender was nice and friendly offered different types of beer I have never had before. Defiantly one of my new favorite bars.

KA2LDTHR4Et79YOfryEk3Q.text: Nice.  Clean.  Young atmosphere.  I liked the comfy looking seats around the bar.  Great happy hour prices.  Enjoyed a small order of celery and carrots with hot wing sauce.  Mmmmm...

gsCxGedolB6YowBhZnmoxw.text: ALL DRINKS at 1/2 price during happy hour 4-7p. appetizers as well.   first couple times around id say the food takes a passenger seat to zipps. for instance the 'sundevil gold' wings are similar to zipps 'golden' but just doesnt have that same bite, ya know. but still a lot to try. and there is not a zipps in tempe, so this is probably the next best thing.  2-3 times the draft selection as zipps as well. pacifico on draft is nice! daily (outside hh) food/drink specials to browse on the website  outdoor patio is probably nice but havent had the chance to chill out there.  a pool table and shuffleboard, tvs, etc, etc.. a fair amount of co-eds to gawk at too. ill return.

yKfDJd-OeoxscEp4y540Yg.text: I used to love Devils. The food is pretty good. Prices and happy hour are great, but the service sucks every single time. Plus I never really got over the time they charged me $2 additional per drink for "rocks" but only after I requested split checks. Manager didn't seem to care either.

3nz1HeMH9LPd7ca1yHiFaA.text: My opinion of this establishment has changed greatly in the last few months. I've visited about 5-6 times in the last year and every time I go things seem to be getting worse. It's hard to tell where the real problem is, mainly because there are so many.  First, I think a big problem in this place is the food. The food specials are cheap ($5), but so is the quality. Every time I go in, it's difficult to know what the quality of the food will be like. I used to love their burgers, but as of late, they have been really overcooked and bland. The wings tend to be either overcooked or oversauced. Thier pizza's are just plain bad (no flavor).  Second, I think the staff is pretty cordial especially when you come in, but as time progresses, they have a tendency to make you feel rushed; especially if they are busy. Sometimes I like to just have a couple of drinks and watch the game. The second you stop drinking is when you should watch out. I actually was approached by someone that I think was a manager who basically made me feel as though I would need to either keep drinking or give up my table.  Third, I agree with others when they say that this place is kind of loud; especially at night. During the day time, it's usually pretty calm, but mainly because most days it's empty before happy hour.  On the brighter side, you can drink here pretty cheap and can always expect a heavy poor especially from certain bartenders. Monica is always one of the people to pour a nice stiff drink; sometimes with only a splash of the mixer. Don't waste your money ordering doubles, you get that and then some in most of your drinks.  In Tempe bars are a dime a dozen, and I just don't see myself making this my regular hang out spot unless it makes some serious improvements.

ixeAeDoNERlne4eXFJS9vA.text: I made a conscious decision to go to the DA immediately following my review... I conquered the Hangover burger...3 patties, 3 cheeses, an onion ring, and a fried egg with bacon...YUMMMM  and if you go Mondays its BOGO burgers!!!!! Daily specials...pool...shuffle board... I'm on my way!!!

L1qCOFO1ENgs41rRVOIqyA.text: Good food, great drink deals, and will be a poppin' spot when school starts

ViowgHsAgdUsjw9b5d0eqA.text: Well its a sports bar with AWESOMENESS!!!  Great specials during the week and a staff that helps to maintain the fun levels without overplaying the "keep it down fellas."  Adam has been my drink faciliator many a times and he's been great with service and explaining some the new beers that come onto tap.  Taco Tuesday is the place to be and with the amount of tv's, pool table, shoot'em up type games and great staff this is the place to go with a group of friends looking to reunite and remember all the blurry and forgotten nights again!  Being close to ASU helps to keep the crowds up if your looking for energy and during the week it cools down just enough to hold a few laughs and good convo.  I'm committed to this place for the food as well.  It's pub grub but its good pub grub damnit!!!

pWKBsYS3JE2epiSizns1aw.text: Great daily specials on food and drinks. A place to hang out where you'll see quite a few of the ASU athletes hanging out too. Hard to beat the atmosphere for any ASU fans looking to get their drink and eat on. Tons of TVs, the outdoor patio is great on cool evenings, and a variety of places to sit whether at the bar, a back corner table, out on the patio, or a high top table.

JDcqjbrrspkOcRpI66wreA.text: Had a great grilled chicken sandwich, my eyes where bigger than my stomach. I like the atmosphere & all of the quotes on the wall.

iW0OsgdizxWtQ00YsS3A2Q.text: Great bar, just plain great.  I know 5 stars shouldn't be used carelessly but I think this place deserves it!  It's a sports bar with a bunch of TV's but doesn't 'feel' like one.  Read on....  First off, it's clean.  For a bar that's down the street from a huge university (ASU), that's not an easy thing to maintain.  Clean facilities, tables, floors, glasses, etc....and we were there when it was pretty packed.  Second; our server was fantastic!  She was very nice, attentive and it didn't hurt that she was a little cutie.  She always made sure we had beers and kept checking on us through the night.  Third; food was really good.  The pizza was really, really good.  Like Italian restaurant good.  I was impressed with that fact alone.  And lastly, if you like Guinness like I do, this place served it right and it tasted great!

uyX-CpY8Kf2eO7V_io2AfA.text: It's really a pity, because I would enjoy going there occasionally for their golden wing sauce and the laid back atmosphere. However after my last experience at this restaurant I will never trust their food again.   I had begun eating my usual order of wings, and I had eaten two or three when I noticed that the drumstick I was currently halfway through was RED and BLOODY in the center. I stopped eating immediately and pulled the other ones open and found that most of them were also undercooked to various degrees.   When I called the situation to my server's attention he carried my plate back to the kitchen for several minutes, then came back and set the SAME wings in front of me, and said "Oh, it's alright. The cooks said those are just veins because we use such large wings. So it's a good thing."  (Note- not even entire rotisserie chickens are supposed to be bloody in the middle.) I argued this point with him and explained why undercooked poultry is a big deal, and even showed him that the meat and bone was still oozing blood. Then he tried to tell me it couldn't possibly be undercooked because they deep fry their chicken for several minutes and then bake them for about 20 minutes more. Which is absolutely ridiculous because then they would be so overcooked they'd be inedible. Apparently a manager got involved and my check got voided so I wouldn't complain, so I left after only a few bites. But what upsets me the most about the whole situation is not the mistake that was made, but the fact that the server kept trying to convince me to keep eating something that could have given me food poisoning, and even tried to pass it off as a sign of quality. Luckily I did not get sick from the little bit I did eat.   Perhaps he just ran plates and was clueless about proper food safety, but a corrupt kitchen staff is even worse. Maybe my experience was an isolated one, but I would advise all patrons to look at their chicken very carefully before swallowing.

PL8-by_Og3qSB8DWVNZulw.text: I love Devil's.  Maybe go there twice a week and LOVE Kendrah and Bailey!

eVF_KcOKR3-_YGR5jbXzAg.text: I strongly dislike the food here, and there have been a number of occurrences where bartender basically screwed my boyfriend over and what not.  If i had it my way i would not come back to this establishment for the life of me. I am not a horny college kid that is here to stare at girls in shorts and their boobs all night.  They have a decent Thursday night special on drinks but i am over that stage in my life where i want to go out and get wasted and drink til i cannot remember type B.S. I would rather go somewhere get a good deal on better beer and wine and have maybe one or two drinks tops with DELICIOUS food. Not crummy food. How can you have a special going on and have nasty food? I think the reason people give such high scores is for 1. The Girls 2. Their drink specials 3. they are drunk and love the food. Yeah its like all the drunken idiots that love Denny's. Seriously? Denny's? Get out of here with that! "Nobody goes to Denny's, People end up at Denny's"  If it were me drinking like these college kids and looking to go out i would rather drink at home to pre game and save money then  go to the bars. That is just me I am thinking logically at the moment!    As i am looking at the reviews on the right hand side majority of my top 3 ideas as to why people are giving such high ratings and i can bet you one other thing is because they are single and have all the time in the world to come here for that special that isn't as great as it used to be. Anytime my boyfriend brings up the name i cringe and want to stay home.

QJiO3nWTkXflM_sOPq5LqA.text: I had lunch at the Devil's Advocate today with a few friends. It wasn't terrible, but not great -- mainly because of the food.  The waitress was friendly and took our drink orders quickly, but then disappeared for a long time when we were ready to order food. I think she may have been the only waitress on duty, since she was helping people on the far side of the restaurant area. It was pretty slow, but that's stretching it a little thin.  I ordered a BLT and sweet potato fries. Both sounded good, but didn't look so great when they arrived. The bread was grilled rather than toasted, so it was a little greasy and otherwise limp. I was happy that they served the mayo on the side, though a little cup of mayo is kind of unappealing to see. The lettuce and tomato were fresh, but the bacon was really odd. It was very similar to the kind of bacon you'd get in England, which is to say that it's sort of like Canadian bacon for pizza. Not crisp, greasy, stringy. Yuck. The sweet potato fries were pretty unappealing too. They were hot but limp and not particularly flavorful.  The ambiance and decor was good, so if you're wanting a drink, it probably wouldn't be an issue. I liked the comfy chairs around the bar, and there were TVs everywhere so it'd be a great place for watching sports. (They had a World Cup game on but the broadcast was in Arabic, which makes zero sense to me.)

yE3tw1EZjt5-44rhyzWY1A.text: I should clarify that when I said there are what seems to be a lot of patrons who are underage, it is not the fault of the bar or their bouncers, at least from what I can tell.  They ID everyone.  I've been ID'd every time I've come here (as have my friends), and I don't look under 21.  I've also stood near the door and seen the bouncers check everyone.  Those who are underage would be getting in with fake IDs.  Just an update to make sure that part of my prior review didn't sound like I was importing fault on to the establishment for that.

flSaAONJgrgZ4qX5xyam4A.text: As SunDevils, my fiance and I thought we should check this place out before a ASU football game last semester (so three months ago). I remember Devil House, and I expected this place to be similar. However, it wasn't similar at all, leaving me disappointed. Devils Advocate had hardly any college aged individuals. Honestly, it seemed to be filled with mostly old single men customers who were harassing the waitresses and the promoter girls. Plus, we just weren't impressed with the beer list or the food. The only plus was that they double booked two different promoters so we got two free shots.

-22_hM7UCAyQVJhtTiKmLQ.text: If i remembered correctly... Thursday nights they have BOGO(buy one get one) drinks. We had some adios and long islands all around, boy was it awesome. Pretty packed here. Filled with lots college kids and some older adults in certain areas. There are TVs and funny signs around this place. Must read them, pretty funny. :) Will definitely come here again when I visit.  great place to be with a group of friends.

zHzpe1RsJjOkW9O24iBO4g.text: My favorite place in Tempe hands down!! I call it "Cheers" and they always know my name...and my drink! New menu items def make the food choices better. Think high end bar food without the gastropub douchebags. No hipsters here, just decent drink prices, good food and no pretensions. If in Tempe, give it a go!

I2t8WwUHKVln1fO9nSJI_A.text: After a night out for my friends birthday while receiving halfway decent service and paying my tab/tipping 15 percent anyway I walked out the door. I was chased and grabbed onto by security and the server Veronica because my friends did not tip well. Keep in mind the bill was paid but she did not receive the tip she thought she deserved. I was held by security until a friend came up and tipped the an amount that satisfied Veronica and was also persuaded to change a tip and sign a receipt on behalf of another friend and that already left. Please do not come here as the staff will hold you hostage until a satisfactory tip will be applied as they advocate the forgery of signatures to do so.

7w9RWlHiKd-nB2CkO5QMiw.text: This isn't the worst place I've been to, but was a long way from being a 5 star. The plus side was the cost of food and drinks. The drinks weren't bad. The food could use a little improvement but still was decent.  This was my first time to DA and I can truly say I will never return. The staff seemed to lack communication and training. 1) We had a party and an area was "supposed" to be reserved for the group. Waiters sat people in our area. 2) We waited thirty minutes for our drinks. I waited another twenty minutes for another drink which I was informed was taken to the wrong table. The replacement was brought out in two minutes. 3) Food that was brought out by a helping waitress had no clue who or what table to take it to.  If this place would work on its training I might consider coming back.

GkfS9fS53HLWjNXp2yehCQ.text: This place was good over the summer but I'm sure what happened tonight! I went in with my son and a friend and we walked in the front door seen several servers just standing around so we sat ourselves on the outside patio. It's 6:40pm at the time we take our table "they are slightly busy" and we are hoping for a server to come over however; a group of 5 walk right in and get served. So we wait another 5 minutes  hoping to get served granted they are getting busy ...now it's 7pm we waited 20 minutes to get one server who was amazing but still took 20 minutes because the other girls that were to help on the patio didn't think we were good to be served. So to fast forward we ordered the chips and guacamole on the happy hour menu only to have my friend grab a bit and low and behold there is a Thumb tack that she bit on while eating "granted this is the first scoop of the guacamole" we proceed to let our server know Immediately and ask for the manager on duty. Well the manager comes out and we let her know about the thumb tack and she proceeds to answer with " I'm not sure how that got in there since we don't use them in or at our store"..... welll ummmmm look it's right here in your face so next! However what went from a place that I did a recommend I will not anymore just due to the comment the manger said. I'm saddened by this but it Could have been worse if my son had the chips and guacamole first. They did comp what we ordered and we stilled tipped our waitress 20% because it wasn't her fault but just double check your food if you do plan on going to this establishment.

gEgYaO3U4CFkuRY6wd9S-w.text: Haven't even had my order taken. 20 minutes since waitress told us she would go get a pen. Terrible service. She was the only waitress around since we got here. Se3SsTsQMw6Nxz3B8jupwg.text: Devil's is a great place to come with friends and hang out and catch any sports game. Their happy hour is the best in town. A nice place to come to and cheer on the sundevils.

b5NXmsokRhKs2vv7icc7gw.text: Great bar, great staff, great food. Games are always on. Pool table is the right color. It's like Cheers only way more popular. :)

C_yiXIGShE1NJoOUFjGGYg.text: Great wings at a great price! they have daily specials that are awesome for food and drinks! I had the mango habenero flavor. Will go back for sure!

5uski5nfmb55WV3mdcmEAQ.text: The food was awesome. I got the Jamaican jerk chicken wrap. Drink deals are awesome. 2 for the price of one on Thursday nights. But the service ruined it for me.....they were standing around and only paying attention to certain customers. I probably won't be back..

eoqENVheaCrrG3BwYDsVZA.text: The bartenders are hasty in their work. Won't give pay attention to what you say. The beer is full of foam/froth on the top! The management should probably work on them a bit more.

BNMu4ikFycR9pauxzFwpng.text: Very cool and relaxed bar that is a lot of fun. I'm a student and stop in if I'm early to class for lunch and beer or just to do some homework. They have trivia night a couple nights a week I want to try!

2_Vr8RCQVkqYLBVpeJ4tjw.text: Worst service I've ever had there tonight. Took one 20 min for a drink and over an hour to get food. The restaurant wasn't even busy. Took out waitress even took 20 min just to come greet us. Ordered the queso dip and it was not warm at all, it was lukewarm at best.

r-J8wQiRBxXpyHbFmRmv1A.text: This place is chill, only been on Thursdays though. Bartenders are efficient and polite. I watched a guy buss his ass all night I eventually asked his name (it was Sam). I've heard their taco Tuesday is good and they have pool tables so that's cool I guess. This place is a good time, but not the like the best time I've ever had. nNSEhWTKfFeGNspwzda8RA.text: Just 3 VERY small TVs behind the bar. Really not close to the bar seating either. Needs a TV remodel BIG TIME!  Good happy hour food specials. wY54-OjSyLqWsBNU2SH8HA.text: Second to last day in Arizona came to this bar on a Thursday and I swear I felt like a star!  Dope experience, everyone was so receptive and just wanted to have a good time. The women... oh my gosh. They were absolutely stunning! WuapkAMOEM3no6Cz1uWOKA.text: If you are looking for a great place, great food, great drinks, and fun atmosphere this is the place to be. Whether you want to party hard or relax with friends this place offers it all! It is by far the best "bar food" you will find anywhere and always with deals and cheap prices! The draft selection is huge and always served ice cold!! I would suggest my favorites the taco Tuesday $1 taco and $2 Mexican beer deal and also the very popular 2-4-1 Thursday's!! This is the best bar in Arizona and I'm sure many other states so trust me done waste your money or time and go there! Also, try the sweet potato frys!!!

U2JcU3xinRVlZGoPFzbRvQ.text: This place is the most poorly run spot ever. They don't have a host, and just tell you to sit wherever is open. Well it was the day of the college football final, and there were at least 3 tables that could seat 4, with 1 person at them each. If you actually wanted to make money, ask those alone to sit at a 2 top, or the bar. These 4 customers decided to go spend our money somewhere else.

WLAZk9p_D7iC2gerZWfalw.text: Fine bar food for a great deal if you go during happy hour. Our waitress was very attentive and always grabbed what we needed before we knew we needed it. Went to watch the ASU game and had a great experience until the sundevils lost. R.I.P.

FUf2oL5jEBA00ZzKeSAmaQ.text: Skyler is the reason you just lost a loyal Tuesday customer. Had a friend in town and took him out for some good food and had the worst service of my life. Typically a great place for my taco Tuesday. Everyone at my table had their food gone before mine ever came and that was after we had to tell the waitress. She never apologized or asked if she could do something to make it better. Then she avoided our table failing to bring us any checks. To top it off she didn't bring back my full change assuming I would leave a tip!

WpRsexk0UcngWWASY5Q4tg.text: We tried this place for the first time this past weekend while we waited for the comedy show to start across the street at the tempe improv. The food was EXCELLENT!! The prices were also very reasonable & it had a cool English pub feel to the place. I also thought the bathrooms were clean & the service was decent. The beers could've been colder but other than that, I was very pleased. I wish I lived closer so I could go there regularly.

lm5X3jtI7jAPZCscVnV_bw.text: Don't go here before ASU games. Coors light is $4!! WTF.  The food is meh at best. The servers are nice though. So I guess one out of three ain't too bad. Or not.     P.s not good about putting college football games on.

pzyXePHtP2X3d9QkMaBqZA.text: This place will always hold a special place in my heart. This is the only Sundevil themed bar in the valley and is at the heart of Tempe. Thursday nights are 2 for 1. When school is in session this place is packed with undergrads and students. Since Mill is dead on these night, it's a pleasant escape from the fist bumping madness. I love mill more than I care to admit, but this place allows you to see a familiar face and have a legitimate conversation. A seemingly impossible task on mill or in old town. Long after graduating I have come to this place and never fail to see someone I know. This place is an icon in the ASU community.

NmBYYV5QIo3vYmuwEPKerg.text: I love coming here on my days off especially because the atmosphere is comfortable. Andy always takes good care of me as well as Johnny they make my drinks how I like it. I keep coming back for the enjoyment of the staff they communicate like no other place I've been too. Usually other places try to have a conversation with you when they drop off the check however these guys talk to you the entire time while you enjoy your drink. Good vibes should be passed around so come on in and ask for these two fellas and you can't forget SKY! Nice guy and takes good care of his guests! Two thumbs up

_04e7bq3sCuGfkOzOLFOQw.text: This is a sports bar & a great place to watch a game. Perfect for a bucket of beer, some wings & lots of noise. It's not a great place to order anything other than beer & wings. Unfortunately, we stopped in here for a quick lunch on our way to an ASU hockey game. We had 45 minutes & it wasn't enough time.  The service started fine. We had sodas pretty quickly. But then it was another 10 to order, and another 30 to get our food. The food was terrible. We ordered the cheese sticks which were cold, and not melted at all on the inside. They were served on a gross piece of lettuce that was still wet. My BLT also had the wet nasty lettuce, and bacon crumbles... not even a strip of bacon. Hubby's sammy was also gross. However my son liked his wings. All in all - don't bother with this place unless you want wings & beer.

EQ3ARziCQ9-MUtgo4vyr3w.text: I'm 15 years older than the kids that frequent this place and probably would not hang out here if someone paid me...drunken college kids enjoying cheap drinks (mom and dad pay the tab so the tips suffer hence the service does as well), too loud, shot guzzling, twerking... You get the pic, we've all been there and most of us don't want to go back (unless you're douchey frosted tip, 40yr old azucar papa chasing young tail). However, the food here is awesome!!! And served late .  No they don't have osso bucco, it's bar food, so think fried, saturated fat ladden, almost zero nutritional value food and it is SPECTACULAR!!! No triple fried wings here.  So if you're old like me, go get drunk elsewhere and then on your way home in a drunken stupor, at around 10pm or so, come here to crash the party and load up on grease. Zucchini, wings, chicken tenders, fries dear God, clog my arteries with this deliciousness. Plus watching kids act a fool while waiting is entertaining and makes you feel glad you're settled for boring and more liver friendly lifestyle.  I will be back!

eMTbrk8vjujwCi9mzcZr7w.text: This place has a pretty good, $1 taco Tuesday, other than they don't have a fish option. It also has a generally upbeat, friendly vibe, but I'm dropping my review score to 3 because...  I bought 2 drinks for me and a friend, which cost $10. To pay for it, I gave her $21 and she never gave me any chance. 15 minutes later, I asked for it and she said she didn't know and thought I'd ask for my $10 if I wanted it back. I consider that a theft attempt.  However, the bartender Veronica rocks.

SyZcIkuUJDX8LJ0er3-B3w.text: Great food, great price, and super personal service! If I lived closer it would be my hang out place!!

1pwL5UYgNUppYw4a801TCA.text: So I come to the DA about once a week on Wednesday's for trivia. Our team usually takes it and with that, you get a $20 gift card, so Ive tried a lot on the menu here.  Sometimes, they have good servers, other times you'll be lucky to get service within a half an hour. Their tator tots are usually good. They give you free refills on juice if you're not a big drinker and their pizzas are usually pretty good. I also like their Frisco Burger. That being said, the food here is usually super greasy to the point of god why did I eat that. Again there's exceptions, but most of the wraps are just kinda meh. If you order a Cobb Salad - good god its the size of a toddler's head, its good but jeez louise its massive. Hard to have conversations here sometimes because of how loud it is, but it is neighborhood-y and doesnt feel like a chain, so hazzah for ambiance.  Final verdict: ordering a pizza is your best bet, the Hawaiian and Spinach pizzas are the best ones, the high top chairs can sometimes be uncomfortable and the tables wobble a lot. Peace out.

qGNLFkGexrDj20jUjO6eRA.text: The staff sucks and they were out of the beer I wanted, and the tequila last time I went. I do live the atmosphere though.

yIvVWMfAJ-ih4aGOuuBHYw.text: Came in for taco tuesday with my buddy, tonight was more relaxed than i have seen before, normally its very packed.  It has a chill atmosphere and great reverese happy hour and some tastey tacos.  Veronica always remembers us by name. We will definitely keep coming back for taco tuesday.

yPl-kyHw94N7tfoqIPPIgg.text: Been coming here for years I love the staff Brian Lauren sky kam and James in the kitchen always make me feel like family I highly recommend coming here for great food great service and amazing drinks

8Xu3JbLsxvOV-6G4sUMo7g.text: A college type bar without the college kids roaming around.  So take that in as your baseline. Food is good for late night eats, I wouldn't recommend this for dinner or a formal date. But what is great about this place is the ambiance and they have a decent beer selection.  They are very accommodating when it comes to big groups, but I consistently have seen slow service, and it is hard to get a hold of the waitresses. We have had to literally flag then down every single time.

1RYyHeebbgrYdUeMywSb6w.text: Devil's Advocate has decent bar food at decent prices.  Good specials, good prices on alcohol, and very good service! So, why not 4 stars?  I'm not sure.  It's super comfortable, and a nice place to go for Happy Hour, or Taco Tuesday, but for some reason, I just never go. Probably only because I've decreased my drinking and am attempting to go vegetarian.  Or it could be that since I work in Tempe, I'm usually eager to get OUT of Tempe...  It should maybe be 4 stars?

f659atQZUIO5cu03ce52Nw.text: Thank you, Brandon, for your hospitable service. However, the triple decker grilled cheese was not enough to absorb all the alcohol you generously provided my stomach with and I spent the next day feeling like death.   Maybe that's where the Devil part comes in?
